number of helpful: 12 of 21 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 9, 2016
Public Review on behalf of the Opium Pulses Steam groupDisclaimer: The copy of this game was provided by the developer for review purposesFew words about the gameEnforcer: Police Crime Action is a a game that shows complete opposite side of GTA series - the righteous side of the law. You're in control of policeman, starting your career from the very bottom of it, showing us with lots of details how does the average life of law-enforcement officers looks like.Advantages - Good, quite uniqe concept of game - Absorbing gameplay with tons of various missions and events - Sounds are done quite well and voicing of characters is predominantly very good, big "+" for it - Control over your characters, whether on foot or by car, is bit weird yet very responsive - Map is impressive thanks to its size and diversityDisadvantages - Mechanics and physics of game are horribly... stiff I would say. There is almost no smoothness anywhere you look around - Graphics are kinda not satisfying as for 2014 release - After few in-game days, it forces you to be always on duty as things that are out there to do are really limitet - Buggy and glitchy as all hellSummaryGame is obviously highly unpolished but devs are constantly coming out with new updates to it, fixing quite alot of issues  (when I watched footage from about 1 year ago, game was in really, really worse state), but still, in my opinion it should be in Early Access right now. Yet after all, game is interesting, I might even say that it's bit addictive once you'll get sucked into it, I would love to see even more refined version of it. Even with all this negativity towards game and developpers, I do recommend trying it out. It's interesting and entertaining and belive me, thanks to "unfinished" state of game, it's even more fun than you would think it is!Personal score6.5 / 10If you find my review helpful or funny be sure to follow Opium Pulses curator page right here for more reviewed games!

												Surprisingly good! Since I'm not a cop I can't tell whether this is realistic or not but I'm guessing it's in the right direction. The overall gameplay is good but it has some flaws. Physics are odd and trucks weigh less than your person so you can actually flip a truck by running into it. Whenever I taze people they seem to fly away for a couple of seconds. None of this is game breaking but it should be fixed.Great level of customization. You can change quite a few things on your cop car as well as your house. You can also buy your own car.The game does however feel "early access" and does feel a bit dated as well. I hope the developers will continue to work on and improve this game. The game is still good and worth a shot. Price is decent as long as they continue to work on the game.

												Overall, this game is fun to play. At times it is fairly buggy and sadly it does not recieve regular updates to further enhance gameplay. However if this genre is your cup of tea then by all means I would reccomend it if you have time to kill. The game itself is fairly realistic; essentialy you complete day to day police tasks such as issuing parking tickets and arresting drug dealers. You have a health bar along with a hunger bar, strength bar and an awakeness bar (both of the 2 latter can be refilled on duty by using fist tool for a while). All the police vehicles in this game are fairly nice however chases tend to be uncommon.Please note: This game is not good for laptops, mine succeeds the minimum requirements but realistically you should use something more powerful, my laptop struggles to handle this game and thus fries itself. number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 6, 2015
												If you have ever played GTA IV LCPDFR then you know the love of serious, realistic, police simulation games. In addition if you have played LCPDFR you know the struggle to get the mods you want to work, hell you had problems getting GTA IV to start, but you did what you had to, stayed up through the night to get everything working because you know how fun it is, and now you are looking at this game because its like LCPDFR except you don't have to worry about bugs, crashes, bad mods, no. Finally a game based around the idea of police simulation. Now the question is, is this game good? Is it what we all wanted? The answer, is yes. Amazingly this seems to be the first success of its kind and on my very first day of playing it I already had 5 hours, keep in mind this was not made by Rockstar, this was made by an indie developer so this is not GTA 6 Police, not even close. This game still has minor bugs, it still needs polishing, it is not finished. Currently the game is very enjoyable and playable, none of the minor drawbacks that I just mentioned damper the games "fun factor" at all. All I meant by saying that is do not expect GTA 6 Police, however what you will find is a game with good graphics, decent animations, a good selection of vehicles, and a good system of fighting crime. And I know that the one question you still want answered before you buy this game, so I will tell you, yes, you can*Pull people over (Traffic stop). When you do this you have the option to check their plates and license, use a breathelizer, ask them to exit the vehicle, issue a ticket, and I believe a couple more. And yes, sometimes they do run and you must chase after them, but whatever the random situation is you have the choice of letting them go free, write a ticket, or if need be, arrest them and transport them to the station or call a police van. You also should tow their car however that is optional. Now for your characters abilites, you can fight with your fists, you have a pistol, you can direct traffic, you have a taser, and you have your radio to call a police transportation van, an ambulance, a tow truck, and help if your police car runs out of gas or has reached its maximum damage capacity. (Yes cars use gas I know its awesome!) And of course you do get random callouts. There is also a level system, I do not know off hand how many levels their are but I believe their is about 15 or 16. You start as a corpral and make your way all the way down to the final rank Chief of Police. Now depending on your rank you will get more dangerous callouts and get paid more at the end of your shift. Now I do not want to spoil the whole game but you do have shifts and off your shift you go to your house, you can go out with friends, own your own civilian car, eat, watch TV, shower, sleep, and many other things. Now this system of off duty is not the greatest, their is not much to do and it will probably be polished in the future. But I do think that it is good because in a game that is centered around police simulation it would be awkward to be on patrol 24 hours a day 7 days a week, so I do believe this is a good system that was put into play. So that is pretty much what you are getting, also do not forget the whole game is open world, no missions! Now if there was one thing that I could say was the biggest problem with the game currently it would probably the car physics, they are not unplayable but they are not Iracing physics. That is pretty much the end of my review and don't think you know everything now because I am happy to say there are many more features in the game still that you can do as a police officer! I do believe it is worth the money and my final rating on the game *CURRENTLY is a 8.7/10

number of helpful: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 30, 2015
												As much as I watched this game receive a lot of negative publicity when it first launched, all the glitches, the game breaking glitches, and so on. Just about yesterday did I really give this title a chance. Now I am addicted to it. For some odd reason. Allow me to give some Positives and Negatives on the game. So you can decide to make your purchase.Positives: -Plenty of Dispatch Missions to take advantage of, which are Challengings and Fun.-Your Police Vehicle has many customization options.-Wide vast area with much to explore.-Plenty of criminals to arrest.-Responsive Controls.-Driving feels very fluent, but takes time to get used to.-Music is actually very good.-Voice acting is on point.-There is always something to do, even when there are no missions available.-Ranking up feels rewarding as you get an increase in pay.-Weather & Night to Day transitions are wonderfully done.-You are able to decorate and buy new things for your home.Negatives: -Aiming can be a chore to pull off, when you are about to get shot.-Sometimes when doing routine checks on cars, the person driving the car will run sometimes, also very far.-When you arrest someone, you are forced to walk. When you want to put them in your car, especially if they run a far distance, walking takes forever to get back to your car which will inspire you to call police dispatch to lighten the burden.-When finished with routine missions, entering the police station for a warrant based on a mission is a problem. When you step back outside the station, the game forces another routine mission on you, removing the perp from the map. Making it difficult to find where they are again. Unless Dispatch decides to update you on their location, which can take a terribly long time.-illegally parked cars don't spawn often, unless you quit, and restart the game. So when asked to ticket illegally parked cars, there are usually none in the street. There is a way around this by ticketing cars on the street by checking their license plates, and ticketing them that way. Its the only way around it.-You take no damage by getting hit by cars. They usually flip over you. Also you cannot kill a pedestrian by hitting them.-You can only arrest one person at a time. When you're after two perps, you have to dispatch the one first, while the other has the chance to escape as you cannot go after them when you have someone handcuffed.-Sometimes Dispatch missions never show up. Because of a game glitch. You have to sleep 8 hours & restart the game. The glitch is caused by the Stress meter being too low. The game gets confused and doesn't turn back Dispatch calls on.-AI pedestrians have a habit of endlessly walking into vehicles, perps in houses run endlessly into the wall, or the door with their body peeking out of the door when you try to arrest them.-The game has a bad habit of throwing you missions even after your shift is over. They should stop. Because when you end your shift with a mission active, even if its routine, you are penalized points. Which you need to rank up.Even with the negatives I think the game is still very enjoyable. Regardless, its up to the buyer. Happy New Year everyone.

number of helpful: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 7, 2015
												I love police games and have played many variations over the years. I was looking forward to purchasing this game and trying it out. Unfortunately, it's fallen not short, but extremely far from my expectations.This game at best feels half done. From the graphics, the game play, and especially the driving almost nothing exactly feels right. The one thing they did try is attempting to give the player more options in how to catch those who break the law. Even this they did with a great shake.Enforcer : Police Crime Action resembles GTA in it's works. You are a police officer who can switch on and off duty by changing clothes inside your house. The house and your clothing can be customized/purchased and a car can be purchased for your own personal use. When you start out without a car, you'll be getting around by cab fare. There are three main bars you need to worry about : stress, hunger, and energy. Stress can be relieved by sleeping or hanging out with relatives, while the other two are quite obvious in how to replenish. What the game sort of did right was the simplicity in choosing what to ask a suspect. For example, imagine me standing on the side of the road and I see a car. I press C to tell the car to pull over then interact with the person inside by pressing the right mouse button. Upon pressing this, I'm given a few options to choose, from asking the person to step out of the car to using a breathalyzer. The animations are basic and none vary from person to person. Some drivers will be intoxicated or some sort of reason will pop up for you to apprehend them. Although it be it the case, I will give the game kudos for adding decoration to the command menu. When setting up a road block, you are able to walk up to your car and pull out some cones. You can also set up a radar to catch speeders but your involvement in that is literally minimal. You set up the radar and that's as far as you go. You will be waiting until you've reached the goal amount or until you get interrupted by a call on the radio. The game is sort of stale for this reason and other users have mentioned this as well. When a call does come up, a little adrenaline rush comes up and so does excitement... only for so long. Upon arriving on the scene of the crime, you will not catch the perpetrators in the act. Rather, they will be somewhere in the area and it's up to you to ask people for suspicious activity. Approach a perpetrator without a gun cocked and you may be kissing the pavement reminding yourself for the next time to run around like an idiot everywhere with his gun drawn. The game tries to act like a cop game, but I don't know of a single cop willing to run around with their gun in their hand pointing them at everyone and telling everyone hands up. This is the other thing, the objectives for the day such as issuing tickets are fun (to an extent) but when you get a call and usually the outcome involves you firing at the suspect and calling an ambulance, there isn't much to brag about. In the game SWAT 4, suspects were unsure whether they wanted to surrender or not which put the player in a real hot seat and gave them a feeling what it was like to be an officer. Here, the scenario always ends up with a call to the paramedic. It is cool that they give you all sorts of options such as being able to call for a police pickup-up of a suspect or being able to tow a car, but even then options feel quite limited. You are able to stop and frisk anyone you see in the street, but again, it's very limited in how everything goes down. People will 99% of the time shoot at you when you answer to a call on the radio. When stopping people on the street, they will give up right away. If they drop anything while they put their hands up, you are able to collect the evidence. Doing jobs properly will result in acquiring more XP and $$. I should mention that cars do get out of the way when your sirens and lights are on. As an added bonus, you can use your turn signals and even put your hazard lights on. Graphics are at best GTA 3 quality and sounds are as basic as you can get. There is no variation in sound as every bullet and siren will sound exactly the same. The game feels empty due to the lack of ambiance. Every map sections more or less resembles each other to the tee.What's wrong with this game? Well quite a bit. Driving first and fore most is the stiffest I've ever seen in any game. Stopping doesn't really stop you and using the hand break will not get you to where you need to go within a turn. If you forget to turn your engine off, your car may start rolling away. AI will keep walking into you and will not try to avoid you, and sometimes will continue walking into a wall. The other drivers on the road have zero intelligence. When they are told to pull over, they will crash right into you or another car. Also, when you do get run over, you don't get ran over... you get pushed by the car. Apparently it's normal for a cement truck to push a person along like it's another day in Mr. Rogers neighborhood. Not only that, the game feels extremely empty. No one interacts, no one looks around funny, no one looks suspicious, no criminal is on scene upon arriving at a forced entry crime scene even if you're right next door to the crime. I want to love this game and because I'm a hardcore police simulation fan I will play it sporadically, but as far as it goes, this game is only meant for people who have an extremely high tolerance and appreciation for this sort of genre.Giving it anything better than this would certainly be a crime.RATING : 6.0/10(This game is definitely not worth it's stated price)Gameplay C+ Story / Campaign C+ Visuals / User Interface C Sounds / Music C Replay-ability C Overall  CScreenShots : Every map resembles this type of sceneryA.I's do a pretty good job pretending you don't existSet up a solid roadblock complete with radarYou won't have to call the fire department ever because nothing will ever be on fireThe collision system is extremely basic in the game. I can't even give him a ticket for hitting my car

												EDIT 30/10/2014 - The developers released an update and I must admit this game is slowly starting to grow on me after playing for a few more hours.The developers are extremely honest and open about the game and are ready to make improvements with feedback from the community.A second update is to be released today and I am looking forward to see what changes they have made and how it has been improved.ORIGINAL REVIEW AT LAUNCH-Total garbage in its current state.The day/night cycle alone is an absolute joke. content:
Posted: August 15, 2016
Product received for free
												At first this game is amazing, then it gets predictable and repititive. This game doesn't seem to be finished, as part of this game is not really realistic. I can understand some of the design implementations such as a red circle that follows the suspects. However their seems to be no physics in the game (ragdoll effects mainly being a concern).  People generally always seem to escape on foot, no hot pursuit action going on which is a little sad. You do these following things repeatedly: 1)Give parking tickets2)Stop drunk drivers/arrest3)Inspect license and vehicle/ticket4)Go to drug dealers (arrest or shoot)5)Go to sick person to make sure they aren't hurtI would say a couple of hours maxes out the replay value. This is the only cop game I am aware of, as you play the game you feel sorry for cops a bit. Realistic mode equals one life, if you die, you die, like being a cop in real life. Bullets can hit you and you would not be able to tell from any visiual indicators in game of where it was shot. There are some things that are removed from being able to be a real life cop, such as backup, bad guys only operate one at a time, no body armor, promotions which don't give any extra endings.

content:
Posted: January 20, 2015
												I have found the best way to describe this game. Whilst going through this page and looking at reviews, I figured I should try it. It was on sale and I said to myself "Why not?" I personally am a very very very large fan of the police genre of gaming (My favorite games being the SWAT Series, especially SWAT 4, LCPDFR from GTA 4 and various other examples) and while I am very biased in my opinion, which is why it is my opinion, I feel compelled to say that I can see the arguments on both sides. Yes, this game is buggy in various ways (Though not as many as I read about. Maybe I was lucky.) And yes it does have questionable graphics. But this game, to me at least, was not made for the general population. It was made for the people who specifically like to play regular cops and aren't all about the shooting and explosions life styles (I realize the hypocritial way I said SWAT 4 was my favorite police genre game, back off xD). This game has an outstanding amount of minute details. So while I do recommend this game, I recommend it to a very small percent of gamers. If you want a game that's about shooting and explosions then this is not for you. Whilst I love explosions and shooting myself, it's a nice change of pace. And yes, the devs do update this game (As shown by the police motorcycle) but at the same time it is a small dev team so you have to accept some problems. All in all I feel this game was made for me and some other small percentage of gamers. If you are truly stuck on if you should buy this or not, I recommend watching gaming reviews and not someone whose messing with the engine of the game and make up your mind for yourself.

												Repetative is the first word that comes to mind when I think of this game. In the trailers it seems as if there are cool crimes to arrest people for such as robbery, murder, or kidnapping. While ther are these crimes that occur they RARELY happen. In the mean time there is really not much to do but the boring repetative stop and frisk, or pull over a breathalize. The controls for this game are a whole other problem. The car is near impossible to steer which wouldn't be a problem if you didn't have to pay your money that you made in the game to repair it. Overall, I think that this game started out with a good concept in mind but with a lack of variety and hard to use controls, the idea never blossomed.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 13, 2016
												So, when I saw this game, I thought it was going to be like Police Quest and be a police sim with some kind of accuracy about it.However, it's a good deal more like GTA from the police perspective.Honestly, I think the thing that throws me off the most is the dialog.  A lot of what's said from dispatch, or the written text, is odd and strikes me as non-English speakers who've never watched Cops trying to write dialog.  I would expect less "There's a murderer on the loose" and more "Shots fired; civilian casualties" or "Armed suspect reported" or the like.  Google searches reveal that the dialog used to be even worse, so this is *after improvement*.There isn't much polish; the little things will constantly eat at you.  Like, trying to back up your squad car feels clunky, or having it slide backwards down a hill when it's parked (which I guess is fixed in the latest patch).  You basically harass and pull over random people to try and make your quotas, with only a few traffic violations being "externally visible".  I will say I was really impressed when, at night, I could actually see people with their headlights broken and ticket them for it.  That was cool, I'll give them that!You can't pull people over for running lights, you can't issue tickets for accidents.  The game doesn't seem to care if you, yourself, drive recklessly and there doesn't seem to be a penalty for damaging innocent cars.  Scarface: The World Is Yours had better traffic law mechanics.  I couldn't even pull over a truck that ran a light, then rammed into a street light and blocked an intersection.And finally, the weather; when it started raining, the sound of the storm was really overwhelming and irritating.  And it was raining inside the police station, which was great.  In my house, at least it wasn't raining in there but it was still equally loud as outside.  Really obnoxious.One of the things that made Police Quest cool was they actually hired law enforcement folks to help design the game.  I'd love these guys to take another shot at this game, with Enforcer 2, and actually hire a cop to help them make it.  Despite all my problems with this game, I really want to love it, and I really tried to, so please try again.

content:
Posted: July 26, 2016
Product received for free
												75/100Enforcer is a simulator game for being a police officer. You work every day and do missions that dispatch gives you, check for drunk drivers check for expired licence plates and such. From time to time you get a "special" crime such as murder robery and assault. The game it self is not bad, i personaly enjoyed it. But ofcourse it is not perfect and there is room for improvement. The physics engine isnt really doing its job well but tbh it kinda ads to the fun. The 20 € they ask for the game is a tad to much and i simply do not belive the game it self is worth that much at this state but if the game dev's improve some parts of it i would definitly recomend this. I have gotten this game in a giveaway and i am happy with it. The +'s of the game :The feeling of driving around as a police officer is really good. You can advance your carrer by doing good things. Ofcourse you can write tickets to the people who did nothing wrong but you get penalized which i really like, since it removes the "being a cop like in GTA" feeling. You can see your actions give good or bad results. There are several "maps" or well, area's inside of the mountain town you are working in and that gives it some diversity. You can get better police cars and you can even have some sorth of a customization when it comes to your police (and the civilan car you can own later in the game (its costly)) Some other features i enjoyed in this game were the fact that you can use comply to make people listen to you, its not one of those meh youre just a cop, you actualy have some respect and authorty as a police officer. There are ofcourse moments where the perp's run away by foot or by car and you have to chase them which adds to the game's action. Id like to add that the graphics in this game is relativly ok and that it doesnt really kill the good vibe the game has.The -'s of the game :Like ive said in the upper part of this review the physics engine is a bit dull, if it happens that you are parked on the sidewalk people will walk all over your car, if you accidentily run someone over you will just slide underneeth them. Another thing i find bothersome is the "roadblock" with the traffic cones simply stop the car, there is no riding around them and such which i belive would improve the game a ton. And maybe a bit more variaty in the missions we get since, stoping 20 cars is ok but still. Im sure that higher rank cops dont do that :) All in all i would recomend this game to people, maybe not for 20 but i do belive that you should grab it if you find it on sale. The 12 hours i have on this game (atm) have been speent by enjoying in the game, and not really being bothered by it. Also to finish this game isnt for everybody, so do watch the trailers, and do follow it. Since i belive with effort from the dev's this can become a really good Police Simulator.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 6, 2015
												Read my whole review (you too excalibur).The games is fun and all and but in it's current state it's not a good game... It needs alot of patches and bug fixes an example is when a car hits you, what happens is that the car makes a flip. Another one is when I travel from one part of MV to another one, my car loses 1 hp. When my sirens and lights are on some cars still manage to hit me and the drivers are not drunk.. Things are very expensive. I was on a mission I had to shoot 2 drug dealers, I got hit once and and shot like 8 bullets. My car got hit by another car and i had to pay for the gas. I had to pay 100$ for the bullets, 200$ for medicine 25$ for my car and 11$ for the gas plus the food that is 5$... I earned 600$. My total expenses were 341$ 600$-341$= 259$. The cheapest car costs 9000$... After my shift I have to either walk home (like 7-10 minutes running) or waste 20$ on a cab to my house. You have to pay to get food out of your fridge, it's 5 dollars... wtf? The physics in this game suck, driving is laggy even with the lowest graphic settings with me and I have no clue why because I can run games like arma and BF4 on max FPS. 2 body shots with an m9 can drop me but with my mp5 I need 4 body shots (m9 fires 9×19mm Parabellum bullets and so does the mp5, this means that it fires the same bullets but I need more shots to drop someone). The map is split in small parts which is really annoying because I get lost alot (for anyone of you who has postal 2, think about going from one part to another) This wastes alot of time on just loading that and I get lost sometimes trying to find my house.. Also when I arrest someone and as for a van to pick them up I see a screen saying "Good job, one less criminal on the streets"... They could've added a truck to pick them up.My advice to you: Don't buy this game unless you are willing to deal with the bugs.This game has potential, if you fix these bugs it will be an amazing game.Thanks for reading this.

content:
Posted: July 31, 2016
Product received for free
												I want to give this game a good rating. I really do. But sadly, this game does not deserve it.I've tried this game a couple of years ago when it first came out. It was absolutely broken and pretty much unplayable. Now that I got an opportunity to try it for free I checked it out again.It got only a bit better than it was before.List of weird stuff I've experienced:1. The AI is REALLY stupid. The cars bump into each other (some of them fly away when it happens).2. When you're looking for a criminal, you can find him often being stuck at the wall of some building.3. The car still gets damaged pretty much all the time (especially when at the gas station) and the fuel runs out very fast.4. Pretty much 50% of the down population have serious problems. Most of the cars they drive are damaged, they're often drunk.. sometimes when you drive through the city, people get out of their cars and try to shoot me. (as far as I know the bullets still do nothing to the cars)5. Spending time with people is a joke. Why would I get a round of applause every time I spent some time with someone?Afterwards, I get teleported to their homes and there's a police vehicle parked in there. What is the point of it? I can't get into it when I'm off duty.6. The optimisation is still very bad. The game has very low quality models and terrain, visibility on low settings is like 10 meters.. yet it still runs like crap. As a hobbyist Unity developer, I know that it could be optimized to be much more efficient than it currently is. I think that the devs had just given up on it. 7. The vehicle controls are REALLY bad. I'm absolutely sure that for all the money that this game have made, the developers could have purchased a decent car controller script from the asset store, instead of having all the players struggle with the current one.I don't think that the developers of this game have consulted any police officer. Why would the officer have to go to the mechanic and repair his vehicle on his own cost, while being on duty? The same goes for refueling. It's paid for by the state/country. I guess that it's an unsuccessful attempt to prevent the game from being boring.Absence of other police officers is also un-immersive. I suppose that it could be justified with the station being understaffed, but I can't imagine an officer responding to a kidnapping or an armed robbery alone and singlehandedly arresting everyone.Also - Tazer is not a bow. The character doesn't have to aim at the sky to hit a suspect with it.And the last thing - the price. This game at this state is definitely not worth this price.On the other hand, I liked the car models and their customisation. Music is not bad as well.I'm not impressed with the rest though, sorry.Overally - I'm disappointed.

content:
Posted: November 3, 2014
												: Hi, first of all I really like the you released, and I have a few ideas and bugs i've found in the game. Here are the bugs- 1. Includes floating cars, primarily in the downtown area, even after the updates, cars still float. 2. Some cars do not pull over by siren, when i'm trying to pull certain vehicles over, they fail to pull over, when i go in front of them they just drive into my car. 3. I found that my left indicator keeps coming on while driving. 4. When I press the number "4" in-game my character is frozen and it can't move. Very big issue. Now enough with the bugs, here are a few suggestions- 1. More police vehicles, assuming the map takes place in America, I, living in the United States assume you don't know much about our vehicles. My city has these cars (Fayetteville Police Department) -2007 Ford F-150 -2012 Dodge Charger SRT8 -2007 Chevrolet Tahoe -2012 Dodge Caravan -2005 Chevrolet Impala -unmarked 2012 Dodge Charger -Unmarked 2010 Chevrolet Impala Of course, since you don't have licensing you can't get the exact models, but its just a idea on what our police cars look like. 2. Police backup I think that calling backup that come in there cars, armed to help you out would be great. I think that would have to be my biggest concern with the game is the lack of other police. 3. Less loading screens It would be nice if when you called a ambulance, a ambulance was actually responding and you can see the ambulance doing its duties, same with calling a police van to pick up someone you arrested, as well as when you call a tow truck, just to add to the realism, i saw you did alot on off-duty, but don't forget about on-duty! 4. Mod compatibility, I think it would be nice for members to be able to create mods that maybe you developers never really thought of. 5. Less rain- I'm not sure if it rains alot in Brazil, but here in North America, it doesn't rain every single day. 6. More call outs- Here are just a few ideas that I think are very important to implant- -Car Accidents (VERY IMPORTANT) -Drunk Driver -Officer Assistance -Domestic Disturbance (2 people fighting, even when you get on scene) Those are pretty much the most important call outs I think the game needs. 7. Faster cars I found the cars go only about 17 mph through the city while the speed limit is 30, I never actually caught someone speeding. I think people speeding should be very visible. 8. Speed Radar I think it would be nice to see the exact speed of vehicles passing by 9. License check It would be nice to check people's license by going back to the police vehicle and checking there name on the police computer. There, we can see if the driver has a warrant/expired license/revoked license. It would also be nice if some drivers didn't have a license as well. 10. Police baton Not very important, though just a small feature. Overall, its a great game.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 27, 2015
												Alright. Never written a review before so. What the hell! Ahem...I'm going to give this a 3/5 in this case. Mainly because its in its baby stages, and theres more to add in this case. So far, the gameplay is alright, Simple so far. Start out as a beat cop (Sort of) Walking around, Ticketing vehicles, setting speed traps, pulling over drunk drivers. There is a minor story in both the male and female characters, but that quickly liquidates as..Well. Its a sandbox..Free-roam. So I can't mark down points on that.The location is....Clunky. In my personal opinion (And others may feel free to disagree) It feels as if you could either move it to a more populated area. (Or create a second map. That would give players a much wider sense of adventure and exploration) Or just expand the area more with more to explore. Eitherway, Once you've seen all the areas, thats it, exploration over.Combat? Well. Rarely there. Or I havn't really progressed far yet. (First Sergeant so far) Fists are rarely used (You could throw a baton in there for variation.) Firearms are suddenly thrown in. Maybe remove the SMG? I find its rarely used around now. Probably for later ranks. Tazers are not the only non-lethals out there, Pepper spray maybe? Good for short-ranged. Less range than the tazer. More range that your fists (Or baton if its implimented). Two hits and your dead, unstandable. Frustrating when you forget the tazer has only one shot and you have to reload. Maybe throw in body armor later on? Seeing as you will more and likely going up against drug dealers, cartels, gangs. It'd be logical to later on recieve body armor for a small cost. Hey. If it gets worse, throw in S.W.A.T armor/uniform! Baby stages!Missions. So far. So good! It started slow with simple hunt down drink drivers, or wander drunks, or setting up speed traps. And as I ranked up I started getting more into the dirty side of crime by hunting down the occassional drug dealer. Like I said, in baby stages so far, but more can be added. So looking forward to more here. Some missions I find quite entertaining. 'Go to X and find Z' One I just find inasne......'Illegally parked Vehicles' Okay. So 25 Minutes to find 7 wrongfully parked vehicles. I don't think Mountain Valley has a drug problem, I think it more has a parking problem. And they're so well hidden that I can't find them! I have to traverse map to map sections just to meet my quota! Oh. And some times are too generous. 25 Real time minutes is pretty much 2 shifts. But when your first shift ends, that progress is lost. Be alittle more less lenient on times..... And...Less illegally parked cars...More drugs and gang violance.Progression. So far, I'm liking the rank tree and the standard 'Gain certain amount of EXP/Score' to rank up. Maybe unlock more uniforms/Vehicles/Housing and such as you level up. Hell. If you get to Sergeant, throw in an NPC Companion maybe! It pays to be ranked! And this job is too dangerous to go alone!Driving. Okay. So far. This will be the main negative part for this. I took a car out, and I swear I was falling into a 'Back to the Future' Moment. Gently press the accelerate button...And...Atleast a second later. 99MPH..... I had to immediantly slam on the breaks to slow down. Heck. At one point I was going in reverse so fast I had to slam the handbreak on as accelerating did nothing! This requires quite abit of tweaking! And the car repair costs are manic, not just because its expensive, its more that its difficult to NOT hit anything. Cruise helps. But. Eh.A.I. Uh. Its not great, but its not so bad either. Maybe some more character models for look. They're not so bad walking, they just horrific when driving. Stop one car, the one behind slams into it and slowly (And painfully) Tries to continue moving. Usually people stop as soon as they hit a car, (Or see a policeman giving a ticket to the person in front.) A bit of an intelligence tweak may be required on the drivers.Customisation? Meh. Five off duty uniforms. Two on duty uniforms. Not great. Maybe add shopping here? Or a new flashy uniform when you rank up? Only one house. Little customisation. An expensive fridge does little to no better than your cheap stock one. Overall Verdict? So far. So good. Alot of tweaks to be made. It does in its own way feel unique. Realistic. And none of that 'Good cop, Bad Cop' rubbish. (Though kicking in doors is quite a good one without caring for minor loss points.)Improvements?- A much stronger progression system. Maybe additional uniforms per promotion. Access to more equipment.- The cars. The speed is an issue. If I go any faster, I might break the time barrier and see the game in the future.- A.I. Yeah. Intelligence Tweak when driving.- Either friendly Police A.I to assist you (Seriously, Can't be the only policeman in this valley right?) Or impliment a co-op feature (Though give that time, Co-Op and multiplayer is when the game is a good few builds away from completion)Overall. Keep it up. And keep going!

content:
Posted: December 16, 2014
												!!!!UPDATE 5/4/2015!!!!!!WHERES THE BACKUP, ONE COP FOR LIKE 5 CITIES, GIVE US SOME OTHER COPS AT LEAST A PARTNER. IF YOU WANT A GOOD POLICE SIM, BUY GTA IV AND DOWNLOAD LCPDFR MOD YOULL ACTUALLY SAVE SOME MONEY.Pros:Solid game premiseNice EnvironmentDecent audioDecent GraphicsGreat potentialCons:This game needs only three things reallyGraphical enhancements (textures,physics engine, for both peds,vehicles and world)More detail (Interiors, diversity in vehicles/peds, calls, activities,)Everything listed above including are all cosmetic and can be brushed up over time.The main issue with the game issimply the lack of well a police department. The ability to have a partner call for backup, ems, fire etc, and actually see it in action is the main feature missing in this game. Even in the most rural of areas there are at least a handful of officers. Even if backup would take a while it would arrive. Other than that I see great potential with this game. Overall as of now "IF" you would like to play a game where you are a police officer that makes a good attempt to do more than just high speed chases and shootouts, and adds the day to day aspects of the job than purchase this game "WHEN" it is on sale. As of "NOW" $20 is not worth what the game currently has to offer.If in the "FUTURE" this game had a: dynamic, immersive environment, similar to that of GTA, the addition of a functioning police department under a broader Emergency System that encompases patrol, detectives, and swat, as well as other units,  a ranking system that allotted you actual command appropriate to the rank i.e. commanding multiple units, support, operations, etc. As well as expansion on the ability to buy/customize your house, buy different cars and have a sort of off the job "sims" like experience. Now that game I would pay $60 for.

content:
Posted: October 30, 2014
												Amazing Concept, Sadly the game isn't quite there yet. It's been said by other reviews, but it really does feel like it's in early access and not quite finished. Apart from the floating cars, etc. mentioned by others, these are the things i found frustrating:- Fuel consumption. Appears to be the same regardless of engine revs... when i first started, i got into my patrol car, and played around with the keys etc for 5 mins. In that 5 mins, my fuel went down to 70%! Just idling in the driveway! Did they install a lawnmower tank in the car?- Refuelling - Apart from the lack of driveway access to the gas station which knocks 7-8% points off your damage just getting next to the fuel pump, Why do I have to pay for the gas? Maybe it's different in other parts of the world but where I come from, the police department pays for the fuel, Not the officer!- Bad Drivers! So, I'm giving a ticket to the truck parked illegally and some bozo drives into my patrol car (which had its lights going parked up on the side of the road). So I pull the driver out, Pat him down and breathalise him and he comes back clean. So I arrest him and take him to the station and apparently i've arrested an innocent man! I guess its not against the law in mountain valley to not look where you're driving. I imagine the same thing would have happened had I arrested the 2 people in cars outside the police station who were sat stationary on the footpath driving into the concrete planter boxes... Innocent too I imagine..Its an awesome concept. and has the posibility of being one of the greats.. but it needs work. I would not recommend it right now.. its a disappointment. If the developers actively listen to the reviews and make some changes that make the game a little more realistic (it is after all touted as a SIMULATOR not an arcade game) then I'd be happy to re-review.. but if like me, you ignore the reviews and buy it anyway, be prepared for a let down.

content:
Posted: October 25, 2015
 Enforcer: Police Crime Action Small Review	Written by: CheezyTheNerdIn this short review I will be going over a few this about this game, an In the future will write a review a full longer review for this game. Keep In-mind this review has been written on my beliefs In which I have seen an experienced, we all experience things In different ways. I am writting this review to show people my experience on this game.  Review    Gameplay The overall gameplay for Enforcer: Police Crime Action, Is basically grand theft auto with less features In a nut shell . The gameplay Is kinda hard to play, with It's slow moving ability an the slight less appealable grahpics. (Which I will speak about In the graphics section). This game has a lot of policing features more then most Police Role-play games , but overall some of the features are quite buggy an not to real-life standards. This game had so much potentianl In certain areas but now just lacks the motivation of the development team to place the certain items In to that game. I rate the gameplay for Enforcer: Police Crime Action a 3/10.    Graphics Enforcer: Police Crime Actions graphic portion of the game lacks In some what of a way. It feels like the game was just based of a pre-made system such as unity. In most games being released there Is a Increased In graphical enchancement. I was terribly upset with the graphic portion of this game, In lacked certain graphics but I can't expect much In a game that wasn't properly prepared. I would rate the graphics for Enforcer: Police Crime Action 2/10.    Developers I haven't spent to much time In looking Into the development team, but I can say this the team Is small and not that much time seems to be put Into this project. I state this because most games they have the deverlopers always reaching out the public of gamers looking to hear what they want In a game. I have followed the forums for a bit to see if any of that Is happening an I haven't seen much of It. I feel that If that this team was larger and had more love an motivation towards this game an It's future I could see a better future for this game an it's community. I would rate the Developers portion 5/10 I believe this game should have went In alpha before becoming a full released game, It was all rushed an didn't recieve the proper attention It needed from the developers of the game. Enforcer: Police Crime Action Rating - 4.5/10	I did enjoy playing this game an have made several videos of It, In which I will have attached below.(several videos I have made)

content:
Posted: October 26, 2014
												The good: The concept of the game is great. Being a police officer and being able to do whatever a police officer does on a daily basics makes the game great. Not to mention the ranking system which gives the game a more MMO feel, where you need to get enough points to rank up to the next level.The bad: Sadly, there is more bad then good. Pretty much the only major bugs/glitches that the game has is with vehicles. Just driving a car feels really bad, in the sense that simply moving forward and turning left for just a second makes the car almost instantly turn 90 degrees. Also sometimes when driving fast and colliding with sidewalks or passing intersections makes the car fly into the air, and do a couple of flips.Another glitch is tha sometimes when firing at an armed criminal, your bullets dont shoot correctly. And by that I mean dont shoot at all, leaving you free to get shot by the armed criminal.I am still recommending this game because as a police fan, this is perfect for me. Adding on that there is no other stable game that accomplishes this.

number of helpful: 14 of 27 people (52%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 24, 2014
												Enforcer: Police Crime Action,Is one of those games that don't look like much when you watch the screenshots, but after playing for just a couple of minutes I'm alreay caught in the game.It's fun, cool and somehow gets the job done.This game is not about shooting and gunning down some unknown people. this game wants you to uphold the law by sticking to the law.A very fresh take and it's a lot of fun.Isn't their anything negative?Uhm, yes, as a matter of fact there's.For instance:- The ingame map is not always that clear for some reason (Could do with some better artwork, or at least a zoom level)- Textures are adequate, but sub par for modern games. Although it doesn't hinder the gameplay and fun factor.- Controls are not always clear. There're many different options and as such you're not always sure how things work. A quick peek manual would be nice.-Ingame time. A full days lasts 24 minutes. In my opinion that's way to fast. I like my days a bit more longer lasting. Let's say 60 minutes or so.So far, this is a nice game already and I'll see myself having lots of fun with it in the future. Especially if they're able to fix some of the things mentioned above.

content:
Posted: June 4, 2015
												I really want to like this game. I mean really. I've been griping for years that after so many incarnations of GTA, we could at least have one open world cop game. (True Crime doesnt count there's too much of a fantasy element there) But in it's current state, this game is only kind of OK. But at the current price, it's just not worth picking up until some things get ironed out. Such as the driving; it's the worst driving with a mouse and keyboard I've ever experienced. I feel like this could be remedied by figureing out a way to have controller support. While it wouldn't really fix the problem, it could make the problem a lot less evident. Character movement is akward, though not as bad as the driving. I would go out on a limb to say that it's passable, but it still needs work as well. I also feel like the devs are working on trying to work on making the game bigger and more complex before addressing these fundemental issues. Overall I cannot recommend this game for it's current state and price. There is loads of potential here though. So hopefully one day that price will reflect what could be a very cool, unique game.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 25, 2014
												This game has a LOT of potential. So far, in its early stages, it's proven to be a very fun game. I played it for about 2 hours and got to level 4. I was a little disappointed that I couldn't figure out how exactly I can get my new car. Now, in the start, you have to spend the first 5 minutes just reading through a very long text that explains how everything works. Instead, I'd suggest a categorized way of looking through things. That way it's better to look over things later on as well.The game mechanics are.. they're not the best. It's sluggish, the car handling is pretty crap and civilians driving trucks often cause traffic jams because they can't turn a tight corner. As far as civilian interaction goes and completing missions that involve finding suspects, it's pretty much impossible. I mean my first callout was a vandalism case. I asked the guy who called what the vandals look like and he gave me the descriptions of them. Problem was, the descriptions matched like 3 nearby NPCs. I'd have no way of knowing which one of them is the real criminal. Some diversity in appearances would be nice. Just retexture the clothes, if you must.DUIs are a little confusing. So I check someones breath and they're under the influence. I get them out, place them under arrest and it gets ticked under "Innocent Civilians Arrested"? DUI is an arrestable crime in pretty much every state in America. Wut.As far as on-duty off-duty time goes, I think there's way too much effort put into the off-duty aspect. The stress level is.. meh. Hanging out with your mother/sister/grandparents/friends doesn't even give you any stress points, which is weird. And what's with the applause as if I've just won an Oscar after hanging out with people?The police vehicle itself is well done, as well as the interactables. Indicators, siren and the strobes themselves. However, it being just red is kind of bland. Red and blue in the future pls. Oh and while I think to mention it, please add a tutorial on how to get a new police vehicle, because I have not got a clue on how to get my new ones. The game is built on a strange engine as well. I mean the graphics aren't really top of the line and I'm lagging horribly unless I run it under low graphics. It doesn't make much sense that I can run Payday 2 better than I can run this.There should also be a little bit of further research be done on the ranks. I mean you don't have Police Officer and then Senior Deputy. Deputy = Sheriff's Office/Department (county). Police Officer = Police Department (city). All in all, like I said, it's a pretty good game with a lot of potential. Needs a lot of polishing. I mean the English itself in the game is sometimes bizarre.

												This game has a very solid base, but obviously is the first of it's kind so yes, it is extremely rough around the edges. Those not recommending the game in their reviews clearly aren't looking at the big picture, and don't understand how gaming (or Economics for that matter) works.First off, I'd like to remind everyone that the original GTA is a piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥ The original 3D sandbox GTA, GTA III is a piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥ But we would have never gotten to the glory that is Grand Theft Auto 5 if people just simply looked at the graphics and didn't support it. This game has alot of promise, and I'm willing to bet tha with the right ammount of support, the developers can turn this into a franchise game easily as it's not your run of the mill shooter. It's a mix of Shooter, Simulation, Roleplay, and Strategy. And you have to balance all three to be successful, thats what makes a good game, variety and uniqueness, not graphics. If you think otherwise, then you're not a real gamer. I'd recommend you just get it now if you're on the fence, 14.99 is alot better to spend than 19.99, and the price on the Excaliber site is nearly $25, so you're gonna have to make a choice. content:
Posted: April 9, 2015
												Great Idea, poor execution.I've put a great deal of time into Enforcer at this point and the best way I can describe the game is a speed trap simulator. The first few days of a character are engaging and exciting. Hearing the radio chatter, responding to your first few calls, arresting a drunk driver. Unfortunately after that the game seems to fall pretty flat. My biggest complaint so far is once you move past your first few shifts, the emergency calls seem to drop off to zero leaving you to complete the bland main daily mission (ticket X number of cars, Catch X number of speeders or drunks) Effectively turning the game into speed trap simulator 2014. Scanning the forums, this seems to be a major complaint stemming from the Steam release of the game. Many ideas have been proposed, like tinkering with the game data or quitting and reloading your game (this apparently gives you a call or two before it returns you to insane boredom). I don’t know about you but having to shut down every time I need a little excitement seems a little counter intuitive to me.Don’t get me wrong, it is still exciting when a driver bails from their vehicle leaving you to give chase on foot, though you will soon find that all runners will return to a walk no more than 100 paces from where they started leaving you an easy target; and this brings me to another point of NPC pathfinding. Nothing ruins a good chase than your suspect suddenly getting stuck on a wall....or a car...or a street sign....Finally I would like to address Super cop and his Jet Fueled police cruiser. Quite frankly, after having a load screen inform me that I could die in as few as two bullets; having a semi-truck plow into me only to be sent flying into the air as my officer stands stoically in his place seems a bit silly. Getting behind the wheel of your cruiser you’ll find yourself subject to some crazy driving physics too. There is very little engine noise from the vehicle giving you the feeling that you are more floating than driving. Oddly enough driving on the shoulder is more engaging as the noise of tires on gravel begins to create the illusion of automotive transportation.In summary, given the current state of the game gives this the feel of an early access game being sold as a finished product. From the sound of it this is very much still "in development" with the dev's still looking for ideas to expand and grow the game which is commendable. Unfortunately this has left quite a bit to be desired in the base game mechanics.If you are a hardcore simulation fan and need something new to eat up a few hours this may be for you, otherwise steer clear until a bit more work is put in, or it lands in your local bargain bin.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 23, 2015
												I've just set up my roadblock and I'm checking cars whether their licence and registration is in order. It's mostly boring work as most people have their papers in order, but I guess it's a part of the job I can't neglect.Suddenly dispatch informs me of a robbery in progress. I promptly respond that I'm on it, get in my squadcar and haul♥♥♥♥♥to the crimescene; sirens, lights, the whole schebang.As I get there, the robberer seem to have fled the area. I ask a few witnesses and luckily I could get some valid information from them on the robberers appearance, what clothes he wore and his approximate age.One man, walking away from me, fits the description to the letter. I order him to stop and as I do, he turns around with the speed of light with a 9mm in his hands. He fires off a shot and misses me by a quarter inch. Pedestrians, people on their way home from work, scream in fear and suprise from the sudden and loud noise. At this point I'm glad I hadn't developed the nasty habit of doughnut-eating like many of my collegues. I pull out my own pistol and return fire. Three times I pull the trigger in rapid succession. All shots land in his upper chest and the robberer collapse to the ground, face down, in the middle of the streets. He's not moving. Between trucks and sedans I close in carefully. People around me stare at the macabre scene in shock and disbelief.I pick up his gun and the goods he stole and call an ambulance. Just another day on the streets as a Lieutenant in the Mountain Village Police Department.Somewhat messy gameplay, tricky as hell to drive, some bugs, but money well spent and very different from a lot of other games I've played. Addicting and fun.Will patrol again. 7/10

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 19, 2015
												I've been waiting for a game like this for so long! Finally some people have deicded to make one. It's not the best game you'll play, it's not the most beautiful looking one either. But it does the job. Specially for a price of $20 this game is worth it. They're constantly making changes to the game and adding new things which have already improved the gameplay a whole lot. In all honesty... if you want to play a good police simulator then I'd say get this game. You can set up radar controls, perform traffic stops, breathalyze drivers and the other missions offer a decent variety of things to do. They also added vehicle costumization which let's you put different light bars on your cars and a different color scheme. As for bugs, I havent encountered that many and none of them are serious... except for that your character somewhat appears to be Iron Man... if a car or even a truck hit him, the character takes 0 damage... no problem! All in all I like this game a lot, and I'm excited for what the developers will do with this in the future.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 29, 2014
												Where to start, well like some games and large aspects in history Enforcer is the wrong excecution of the right idea. I love the idea of a Police Simulation because unfortunately at 16 I can't go out and "Simulate" police work. The idea of the free-roam police game with no set objective intrigues me along with the side missions that come with it. The game is just a bit buggy (a bit? HA!) The game reminds of the kind of game you'd get in a cereal box along with Monopoly and Rescue Heroes because the graphics are just about the same. I find myself stealing police cars in grand theft auto and doing the same thing that I do on Enforcer but unfortunately I can't right tickets or use a tazer. I love the basic elements of Enforcer : Police Crime Action. I think the game is a good buy if you want a repetitive and menial game that has no specific goal but honestly with my lack of knowledge of police forces it is pretty acurate (Except the game doesn't make you do paperwork!!!)    I thought the personal aspect of the game was... different. I think once again it is the wrong excecution of the right idea. If they merged it with the personal life of say "Sims" for example and the graphics of Arma 3 or GTA 5 I think you'd have one hell of a game. But unfortunately the game just isn't there yet. I'd say buy it if you have 15$ hanging around but for the price it really isn't worth it unless you're up for it. I'd still recommend the game and I intend to continue playing but there is A LOT of work to be done. 7/10

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 29, 2014
												Where to start, well like some games and large aspects in history Enforcer is the wrong excecution of the right idea. I love the idea of a Police Simulation because unfortunately at 16 I can't go out and "Simulate" police work. The idea of the free-roam police game with no set objective intrigues me along with the side missions that come with it. The game is just a bit buggy (a bit? HA!) The game reminds of the kind of game you'd get in a cereal box along with Monopoly and Rescue Heroes because the graphics are just about the same. I find myself stealing police cars in grand theft auto and doing the same thing that I do on Enforcer but unfortunately I can't right tickets or use a tazer. I love the basic elements of Enforcer : Police Crime Action. I think the game is a good buy if you want a repetitive and menial game that has no specific goal but honestly with my lack of knowledge of police forces it is pretty acurate (Except the game doesn't make you do paperwork!!!)    I thought the personal aspect of the game was... different. I think once again it is the wrong excecution of the right idea. If they merged it with the personal life of say "Sims" for example and the graphics of Arma 3 or GTA 5 I think you'd have one hell of a game. But unfortunately the game just isn't there yet. I'd say buy it if you have 15$ hanging around but for the price it really isn't worth it unless you're up for it. I'd still recommend the game and I intend to continue playing but there is A LOT of work to be done. 7/10

content:
Posted: October 29, 2014
												(Important note for Fsecure users: Disable deepguard while you play this game)For anyone with an interest in police work, this is a fairly good game. The calls are varied and the situations feel organic with the suspects reacting in a believable manner. For example, drunks and thieves are unlikely to pull a gun on you (but much more likely to flee) while hardcore criminals with drug raps and worse tend to violently object to your stopping their crime sprees. Also, the locations of the criminals are not automatic and sometimes you just have to go around looking for them either from witness descriptions or behaviour described in the initial call (example: rowdy drunk). The game does give you hints after a time in the form of radio updates about the rough location of the suspect(s), if you are worried about never finding the perps. The police procedures are sometimes a bit off (you generally want to cuff the perps before searching them, devs...) but overall the basics are there. Note that this game is meant for people who WANT to follow police procedure. If you want to mess around, the game basically ignores it and it will feel weird. But then again, if you just want to mess around in an open world, why are you here? GTA series are that way --->The game has problems too. The driving model is wonky and there are some glitches and bugs around, some amusing (like trucks launching in to orbit) and some not (a car parked 10m in the air....).Its not the prettiest game in any way, shape or form either. In the end of the day, this is a game for cop fans and no-one else. Being one, i recommend it. If you have no interest in patrol police work then this game is really not for you.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 12, 2015
												Police Quest meets SWAT meets GTA III.This is the "right side of the law" simulator, I always wanted many other games to be.The interaction and immersion is great. There is sooo much you can do, while capturing the day-to-day grind.  While this could become boring, it does a pretty good job capturing the realistic career-risk of any "routine", where even a routine traffic stop can turn suddenly violent and the player faces sudden and possible death.It is not perfect.  There areas I wish would be improved upon.  My primary issue is, there is no, "backup" support.  You do not have a partner, and you can't call for backup.  I feel this, could be rectified in an expansion, which, maybe we will see some day.  This shortcoming, I was able to justify with the rationale, that, the town is pretty small, it "might" be possible, that you are the sole law enforcer on payroll (and of course dispatch).Enjoyable game, does a great job of immersing the player in the atmosphere.  Visuals are well done in many areas.  The open-world, random citizen/criminal generation keeps the replayability going (and humorous at times... my first day on patrol, my first three suspects were woman truck drivers... immagine my shock when this cute girl in a sexy dress jumped out of her truck and pulled a gun on me...).The realistic mode really draws you in to the life & death risks of the job... you learn to rapidly eject from your car in a chase, taking up cover behind your car, very quick.  My player has died in the line of duty four times (meaning permadeath-restart from scratch), before my latest actually has survived up to LT (and still going).There is a more arcade mode... haven't played it, where death is not possible, but injury is.  This brings me to the 2nd issue I have with the game, I believe their should be a second mode, where both injury or death is possible (not always one or the other).Great game.  Hope to see more from the developer.Definitely recommend this game.10-4!

												This is a well put together game. I love playing it everyday and all day if i had the time. I like the concept of the game and how you can pretty much do what you want. I would like to see a spot light added to the game. I also wish you can detain the subject your dealing with in your vehicle until your done investigating making the decision if your going to place them under arrest or let them go. Im very big on the lights n i love what they have done so far but i will like to see the LED lights reflect off the buildings and other nearby objects from like a block radius because when i turn on my lights i like for people to now im in the area from miles away just on how bright my lights are reflecting off of other objects. I also would like to see more graphics especially in the city. My biggest dislike is the handling of the vehicle, it never stops in time and turns are too aggressive i just wish it was more realistic on the stops because i also crash into something because it takes forever to stop no matter how fast are slow your traveling. I also want to be able to use the computer in the vehicle to run ID's and driver's license. Although im waiting to see all of these things happen this is the best police simulator game I ever played, this game is going to make history.

content:
Posted: February 19, 2015
												I've been waiting for a game like this for so long! Finally some people have deicded to make one. It's not the best game you'll play, it's not the most beautiful looking one either. But it does the job. Specially for a price of $20 this game is worth it. They're constantly making changes to the game and adding new things which have already improved the gameplay a whole lot. In all honesty... if you want to play a good police simulator then I'd say get this game. You can set up radar controls, perform traffic stops, breathalyze drivers and the other missions offer a decent variety of things to do. They also added vehicle costumization which let's you put different light bars on your cars and a different color scheme. As for bugs, I havent encountered that many and none of them are serious... except for that your character somewhat appears to be Iron Man... if a car or even a truck hit him, the character takes 0 damage... no problem! All in all I like this game a lot, and I'm excited for what the developers will do with this in the future.

content:
Posted: November 9, 2014
												If your looking for a good police simulator then look no further. This game(as it is still in development) provides almost all the policing experiences a cop could experience in his every day life. However there can definitely be some improvements to the game as far as exanding the map to be more of an open world sandbox and have additional CPU police to patrol around as well and maybe even multiplayer. This game has a huge amount of potential to be the best police simulator out there but it still needs quite a bit of work to get there with minor bugs and a little bit more of a relistic feel. What I mean by realistic feel is when you play the game everyone and everything gameplay mechanics wise seems to be robotic almost, the civilians almost seem like they have no life to them at all, they look like robots walking around and the driving is a little unrealistic in the sense that if a car runs into you, it doesn't harm you but it harms itself by somehow flipping over and going out of control. Like I said though, this game is a great simulator because of the wide variety of missions and calls that a normal cop would answer to in real life. The basic concept of the game is fantastic, its working out great as far as how policing is done so far. If your like early development games and policing then I highly recommend this game, however if you like a full complete game and not something in development then I suggest waiting a little longer before purchasing the game however the price of the game may increase like almost all games that are in development always do. My suggestions to you devs as far as making the game that much better is 1-Multiplayer. Co-op multiplayer and maybe even VS Drug Lords VS Cops/Swat2-Implement more AI- patrolling around and busting bad guys and all is really fun but the lack of other police patrolling around and no backup seems a little unrealistic and a little dull, having a team to work with or maybe even command when your a high ranking officer can definitely spice up the gameplay and make it a lot more interesting.3- Implement S.W.A.T- Everyone loves swat...No question about it. Swat is a huge help during tight situations and if there was even an option to play as swat and just go on raid missions, breaching and clearing, taking out High Value Targets and etc. that would probably spike this games badassery up by a ton. Everyone loves that feeling of being a badass S.W.A.T with a team about to breach and clear or just go into an area to raise absolute hell. Implementing S.W.A.T AI backup in the game and even a S.W.A.T mode would just be awesome4- Connect the maps together to make one big sandbox- Instead of seperate maps, connect them! I think most people would prefer a sandbox rather than different sections, especially if the different sections of the maps can be really small in comparison to the main city.5- Implement more traffic violations- I've noticed that every time I pull over a car for blowing a red light or even crashing into another car yields no bad outcome whenever they are pulled over and traffic stopped. I always mistake pulling people over for blowing through red lights and think I'm going to ticket them but the game doesn't pay attention to them blowing red lights, implementing that would be pretty cool too.For all of those people reading this review all the way through good job! lol and thanks for reading. As for the Devs, nobodys expecting all these suggestions to happen in like one week, we can wait however don't blow the suggestions off otherwise the game will get dull very quickly because there is a lot more that you guys can add to increase the feel of being on the Police Force. Don't quit! This game has potential over all other police simulators to be the best because so far you can do a lot more in this game as far as policing than any other game made so far. You guys are doing a splendid job and I wish you the best of luck developing this game, I can't wait for the final product because if you guys can make it this good this early in development, you guys can definitely make it amazing with time. Don't quit! A lot of people will support this game to the end!

												The reason I'm saying no because as of my review date (10-25-14) the game still has many bugs. The drving mechanics are very wonky. Posted: November 3, 2014
												I gotta admit, this game has it's pro's. I like a bit of realism, and being able to pull over, check, breathalyze, arrest and transport is lot's of fun. The constantly running perps who take you miles from your vehicle, the tedium of keeping your stress level down, and the annoyance of having to play hours before you can drive around off duty are pretty big detractors. Having said that it appears the developers are working very hard to get this right (eventually) and that speaks volumes for the games appeal. Is it LCPD:FR? Nope, but it is trying, and with the addition of backup units, even a cutscene style state police call where they come and "help" by arresting the fleeing vehicle, (I'm tired of spending tons of money fixing a cop car that has to be used as a battering ram every time I get in a chase) would make this game absolutley worth it. For now 6/10 with the potential for 9/10. Go ahead and buy it, play it a little and wait for those awesome updates I'm expecting soon.

content:
Posted: January 17, 2015
												YES! YES! YES!This game is great and if you ask me, underrated. So far, there's enough to do in a day to keep you mostly satisfied. I would like to see more in future updates. I will leave a list of my own suggestions towards the end of my little review here. The graphics aren't impressive, but they're at least tolerable. The vehicle handling has something left to be desired, mostly the handling. Cars pick up speed well enough but turning without hitting anything is tough lol at least for me it was. If you crash into a pole it will knock over, that's a plus. I really dislike a stiff enviroment that doesn't react somewhat realistically to that kind of damage. Car models are decent and acceptable. Customizing your apartment is a nice perk, although somewhat limited. REALLY enjoy the traffic cameras. Theyre fun to play with when you just want to sit and watch the pedestrians try and get one over ya behind the wheel >:DWould like to see in future updates:Longer shifts (I am aware that players can edit files to lengthen day and night times, since I and others are not this comp savvy...I would like the devs to give players an option to set their shift lengths in game.)More cars! :D Cant go wrong with that can you?SWAT teams after certain ranks, which can also brings me to this : add more NPCs that rob banks and shops. Multiplayer modes like Cops VS Robbers, Co-op shifts, and just open servers for random lawlessness.MORE CUSTOMIZATION FOR YOUR CHARACTER AND THEIR HOME! :DArmor upgradesVehicle customization on a deeper level (speed, acceleration, breaking, armor rating, ect)Weapon customization (purchasable unlocks, attatchments, police equipment, ect)When you reach police cheif, there should be an option to "run the city" where you are able to command other officers and oversee them. Perhaps some officers are corrupt and you need to do some surveillance? Or you need to manage a dispute between to officers who are partners? or you need to hire or fire more officers? upkeep on funding for vehicle management and police needs (equipment, weapons,  ect)A ranking system that goes a tad bit beyond medals you only see dangling after a days work. Perhaps some wearable rank insignia? Or more priviledges/jobs to do that officers of that rank do irl? profile badges that signify rank?A "superior NPC" who monitors your performance, chimes in with advice via the radio or in person after a days work, pushes you to do better or to do certain things to make quota.Just my own input.Two thumbs up so far, though! If you want a good simulator that's fun and gives you that epic "respect mah authoritah" feeling, here it is :D
