content:
Posted: August 1, 2015
												====================================================================================Summary====================================================================================Enforcer: Police Crime Action is a Police Simulator where you live your life as a male or a female fufilling cop duties and normal civillian ones such as visiting relatives. The games main gameplay is going on duty which is where you get your main objective which can be something like 'Use Speed Cameras to ticket 4 cars.', though you don't have to complete this, you can go around and interogate random civillians and frisk them and if they have anything illegal then you can arrest them. Missions can range from kidnapping to armed robbery. You take 2 shots and then you're dead, on realistic you will lose your character though on Normal you will have to pay a hospital bill. You can decide to go the police brutality route if you wish, though no matter how many times you shout 'Stop Resisting' you won't go unpunished. The game is very unpolished at the moment but it's the only game of it's kind and so It's a nice change of pace and a very fun experience.====================================================================================Gameplay====================================================================================You can either go on Duty or Off Duty, being Off Duty allows you to parcitipate in things like visiting relatives and driving around in your personal car (which you must buy first) and decorate your own home with your hard earned cash. While on Duty you will be given a Main Mission though you don't have to do it, there are a variety of different things you may have to do but the more intense missions come later in your shift when you may have to deal with an armed robbery, burglary or even a kidnapping. You will be interogating people around to see if they have any info leading you to the guy/girl (Though in the game everyone is an 'It') you're after. Be warned however as people can pull guns on you so it's best to be prepared in ALL situations, 2 shots and you're dead though you are given a bit of leeway as they take a while to shoot each shot. Of course if a civillian happens to be walking down the street you are allowed to pull out your taser and begin zapping them while they clearly resist arrest though of course you will be discredited and if this occurs too many times and your score goes too low then you will be fired.====================================================================================Conclusion====================================================================================I give the game a 7/10 for being fun, interesting and unique as hell as Police Simulators aren't really a thing but this game makes it a reality. The game should be in early access due to optimisation issues, bugs, flaws in systems and just a lot of problems though the devs are updating the game and a new update promises a partner which should be interesting, I'm giving this a positive review as this game is heading in the right direction due to fixing the game up after the awful launch. Maybe wait a while till you purchase the game when you see fit that the game has been patched and made better. As long as the devs don't stop and they persevere this could be a great game! Though if you are contemplating picking it up now I would get it on sale such as of the time of this review the Humble Bundle for £3.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 26, 2014
												While not perfect this game is fantastic. I say this because rarely does a game make me lose all track of time. I grew up with the Police Quest series and until recently, I've played the Police Force series from Excalibur Publishing  (makers of Simulator games). About a year ago, the maker of Police Quest, Jim Walls, was trying to revive the Police Quest series and bring it into the 21st Century but sadly it left Kickstarter and ceased. If you've played Police Force, there are some things alike. You can walk around, accept emergencies, and use the number keys for "actions," Enforcer definately uses Police Force as a foundation but expands on it greatly and whoever put it all together definately should get a raise! I have to say that the devloper and his team really did a great job. You are able to have a home and when your shift is over, you can spend time there eating, watching TV, showering, sleeping, and/or taking a nap. Any of these things can help your stress, hunger, and alertness. All of these can have an affect on your aiming in sticky situations as well as your life ( you can die if you don't eat). You can explore any of the 7 regions but your patrol area is within Mountain View. You can buy furnishings for your home and at a higher rank, you can upgrade your patrol car as well as buy a car while off duty. Your home is kind of bland. I wish that my house looked a little nicer than the shack it resembles. I do find it odd that when I'm off duty, my patrol car seems to be parked at my house. I though I would have to drive (walk, or take a cab) to the Police Station, and get to my patrol car. When I go to the Police Station it's void of any NPCs. Your main reason inside the Police Station is too check email, ask for a warrant, or go off duty. When you have suspects in custody, all you do is click the police station door (without going in) and a window pops up asking if you want to put the suspects in jail. Clicking the window, tells you how you did (giving expierence). You also get expierence putting tickets on illegally parked cars and towing them away when a driver fails a breathalyzer test.While on duty, dispatch will squawk emergencies and you have the option of excepting. If you do, dispatch alerts other officers that "26" (your call) is in route. It would of been nice like in Police Quest, to be able to click a button to alert dispatch og your whereabouts (ex. "dispatch, 26, is heading south on main or dispatch, 26, is on scene or requesting backup. I found that when a suspect raises their gun, you don't have much time to react which in real life is true but there should be something that allows you to walk up to the suspect and if he/she pulls out a gun, how can you survive.  I have to say that the game makes you learn. If a murder suspect or drug dealer is your emergency, you bring your car close enough, and if things get hairy; jump in your car for a better strategic location. I did find that outside, the perp runs and you can command them to stop. The one in the mini-mart only allows me to take him down. I wish there was an other way instead of killing the suspect. By the way, the mini mart only had a counter.Your patrol car is fantastic. I love how you can get in, turn on your lights, (high beams also),  turn in the warning siren ti pull people over, turn on the emergency lights for persuit, and siren. You can set up speed traps and road blocks to check traffic. The help screen is a nice touch. I wish that there was a quick tutorial that goes thru it by putting you in each situation.I love how this game is open ended on the realistic side. It won't end unless you retire. You can rise through the ranks from patrolman to trooper captain ( I think, I would habe to look). Rising through the ranks seems to allow you to be able to buy a car, upgrade your patrol car and/or buy another. That seems it. I wish we were able to see other cops, mingle with them as well as call for backup. In Police Quest, you would be at the Police Station, shower, change into your uniform, go through a briefing with the captain, grab your walkie and patrol keys. I see the speed limit signs which is realistic, however, when I was not called to an emergency, I find that me speeding, had no effect as well as running red lights. I thought when you don't respond to emergencies, as a police officer, you still must obey all traffic laws. All in all, for $19 (from the release date till Oct. 31st, it's $15) this game is really good. Yes it has bugs (cars parked 5 ft. in the air), poor path finding by NPCs but the game has already been thru 2 patches so it will be interesting how this game evolves. I'm hoping it's constantly supported with added DLC and expansions. This game has the potential to be fantastic. Now while this game has some bugs, it certainly doesn't make this game unplayable. It's still very enjoyable!Interstingly, a patch came thru during the weekend. Cudoes to the developer for working "after hours." Don't think it's not appreciated!

Games that I have that were released years before this game look better than enforcer. even on ultra the detail is pretty bad for this game. -18. Horrible AI intelligence -19. I put out a road cone an NPC car bumped it and went FLYING through the air. -110. A suspect pulled a gun on me he did not fire within a second I frisked him and found nothing -1Pros1. game gets regular updates +12. easy to edit game files so you do not have to eat every hr or fillup gas every couple minutes. +13. its the only police sim I know on steam +14. Still fun to play a bit I hope they keep updating and improving the game though. +1

content:
Posted: April 20, 2015
												Enforcer: Police Crime Action has it's moments, but has had minimul effort put into it on certain topics of the game. When handling every day human emotions and requirements (e.g. stress, hunger, thirst) It adds to the realism within the game. When dealing with stress you can watch television, or perhaps go see a loved family member or friends, but quite frankly when visiting family or friends I noticed that you don't actually get to play the part in hanging out with them and instead it brings up a photo with the sentence underneath saying "You have visited a friend/family member" which is quite a let down.The title being "Enforcer: Police Crime action" makes it obvious what the game is based on, but when performing traffic stops you have choices of what you can do to the driver you have pulled over. If you want to test a driver for alcohol consumption then you can, but if you decide not to check for alcohol use and it appears they actually had been drinking whilst driving you get "points deducted" from you, and all I could think to myself is "I don't recall Police Officers having magic powers telling themselves, after they had checked the driver what the driver had done wrong." And I also don't remember my local Police having "points" taken away from them, I mean they're treating it like it's a challenge when it is not.Another thing that caught my attention was you can't actually begin your shift at the Police station, and instead you start it at your wardrobe which I thought was random. The thought of not having to go to your area of work placement, and taking orders from your boss/ Police Sergeant is another sign of poor effort, and I had the complete opposite image of the game before I bought it and when I was reading the description.When I noticed that you could upgrade your home I started to slowly change my opinion to a positive state of mind about this game, until I noticed you cannot use them and is mainly there for show. When watching TV you don't actually get to observe anything. Another point which shows lack of effort is when your hunger level gets very low, to recieve food you don't go to the store and buy the food, you don't get the food delivered to you, you pay your fridge to give you the food which made me sigh deeply as I wanted this to be a simulator and not a life that takes it easy on your worn out legs relieving you from walking to the store.As a conclusion I would not recommend this game to anyone. This is because what they say you can do in the description on the Steam page is not 100% accurate at all, and mainly consists of having text grief being thrown at you for when you don't check a drivers ID. Also for when you think you get to live a normal life in this game it is the complete opposite and you do not get to spend time with family or friends, you just get to see an image of them when you click "Hang out" with them on your mobile phone. Over all a 3/10, mainly because of the lack of effort that was put into this game. If more detail was added such as actually being able to spend time with people, and having to do what you do in reality then I could most likely bump it up to 6, maybe a 7.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 8, 2015
												First off, I love this game. However, it does have flaws that need to be adressed.1: Vehicle handling is awful. Doesn't even make sense at times.2: Running criminals will stop and walk normally like nothing ever happened after 30 yards, instead of continuing to run or trying to hide.3: Criminals with guns with will sometimes wait up to 8 seconds to start shooting you.4: There are not enough things to spend your money on. You only get to buy 3 cars, and buying furniture for your house is nice, but not enough. It would be nice to be able to buy a new house, and place it wherever we want. 5: You can not recruit a partner, which is very unrealistic.6: Gun play is not very good, considering there is no recoil at all. It would be nice if there was, and as we gain stress levels, the recoil becomes greater. 7: Criminal AI is awful, they stand in one spot when trying to shoot you, instead of trying to get behind cover.8: We need more content, after you play the game for about 3 days, you have pretty much seen everything there is to the game. Give us more missions, more cars, more houses, more gun options, gun customization, a recoil system, partners, trucks, ect.9: It would be nice to have an actual Story Mode. This would entice us to keep playing and staying interested in the game. It mentions that your grandparents dont have much time to live, maybe you could play on that a little bit? 10: MULTIPLAYER! The fun of this game would increse tenfold if we could play with a friend. I'll say this again, I love this game and want to see it grow. However it is very unpolished and until the problems listed above are adressed, I couldn't reccomend this game to just anyone. But if you could look past the problems, you just may find your new favorite game.

content:
Posted: September 1, 2016
												The whole premise of this game is great, you just play the everyday life of a cop rising through the ranks by catching people speeding, dui's, drug deals etc. HOWEVER, i wish they probably had more of a budget on this or whatever happened to make them stop updating, right now its more like a police simulator.Pros: - You actually can make traffic stops and even the simple mundane tasks of a normal cop, with the occasional drug deal/ homicide.- The energy and stress level bar is actually realistic, certain activities cause your character more stress than others, the same with energy.- You get paid and can customize your home with different furniture (although it isnt much), for example,  getting a better couch allows you to sleep less but reduce stress and improve energy levels more than the old one.- You have a variety of squad cars to use (although you have to input codes to get them) like a charger, pick up truck, motorcycle. you can also customize light colors and what the car looks like to a point.-The graphics are good, well good for a small time developer.Cons:-AI is pretty bad (while i was parked a guy just walked over my car from the hood to the back of the car, another was just walking into a wall)-Repetitive, theres no real plot or story (Why i called it a simulator)- when you reverse it takes ten years to start going forward again- If you get shot twice or get shot with health even at 99% you die instantly.- Voice acting is very minimal like literally i think the actor said only 4 sentences. Improvements:-Ai actually be intelligent-better health system (so you dont die with one shot) - More missions-When you choose to hang with friends maybe have like a cutscene or something.-Call back-up also NPC cops.-if you shoot someone and call for an ambulance, one actually comes and you can try to keep them alive while it comes.But all in all, its fun but probably should cost like 5-10$ less, if the updated it more than maybe it would be worth 20$

content:
Posted: October 28, 2016
												I've had this game in my library for probably close to a year now. At first I was really optimistic about it. It had amazing potential, and despite the bugs, it was fun to play and the developers seemed to be involved. 9 months later, this game hasn't been touched and there's aspects that make it almost unplayable. The glitch that makes this game unplayable for me is the one where your weapons sometimes don't shoot at all, no matter how many times you try. This leads to the criminals killing you.  This game is like finding out you're pregnant with Albert Einstein and 9 months later giving birth to Kanye West. 2/10, wouldn't recommend.

The game had a lot of potential but most of the features are stupidly added (eg. A Tiredness Bar that does nothing that raises your stress level which also does nothing). The driving is horrible and the walking is even worse if that is even possible. How this game even is able to be priced for how terrible it is I don't know, but I wouldn't even recommend this game for $5 if you really want it. Get it for $1.

content:
Posted: March 29, 2015
												I think this game gets unjust reviews. Sure, its graphics can be considered lacking, maybe around a more ps2 style, but that just means older pcs are welcome to join in on the fun. Driving is touchy, especially in the different models, but there are more than enough good moments in this game to keep a player coming back. The pedestrians are quirky, so it may seem lame to some, but I think it breaks up the repetitiveness of the game. Different things to do, such as setting up road blocks or speed radars, busting drug dealers who seem to always have a gun, serving warrants and more. This game isnt difficult to learn, and is a great time killer. I got on Steam sale for 9.99, and I would say that is the price YOU should shoot for. Pros-Variety of missions leading to different styles of gameplay.  (Laid back pulling speeders over, or gun ho, busting dealers)-Customizable clothes, cars, and house.  (Not a huge variety, but enough to set you a part)-Easy to learn-Tons of potential-Taser the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of someone. Cons-Outdated Graphics (Older systems welcome)-Touchy driving system-Lack of interaction with HQ, other officers, and other agencies.-Turning on/off car over and over-Turning on/off all your lights and your siren. -Gas and damage system are “iffy”7/10 Would smoke a bowl waiting for speeders just to have the perp run on me so I can shoot them in the back with 10,000 volts.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 29, 2015
												Day 1------------------------------- Went to set up speed traps on the main highway, got a call from dispatch about 2 possible vandals in the area.-Asked witnessneses about said vandals, found one.- Asserted myself as a police officer, immediately got shot.-Returned fire, killed suspect, didn't see his friend behind me.R.I.P. 10/10 Would patrol the Ghetto again.Pros---------------------------------You can do anything that a police officer would in realistic fashions, Check for Drunk drivers, set up road blocks, speed traps, issue tickets, search people for drugs, weapons, etc. -Customizable home, and squad cars-Ability to purchase new guns (New pistol, assault rifle and SMG)-Cars and suspects will both try to run from you which leads to "High speed" pursuits (at 30 mph) -Investigate calls of possible thieves in people's homes at 3 am (Which is always fun kicking in doors)-Multiple dispatch calls across the state, everything from murder suspects to drug dealers, to just a routine traffic stop that turns into a gun fight.-That look of disappointment in your grandfather's eyes in the picture when you visit him. :P-Herbert the pervert, which is a strange looking individual which you should keep your eyes out for, you'll know him when you see him...Cons-----------------------------------------------Buggy (I've seen some really weird♥♥♥♥♥♥playing this game.) Seen everything from people driving cars with 4 hands, to cars driving down the road with people standing in front of them like nothing happened. (Once I even seen two semi's get it on.)The only bugs I have found that break the game is that in realistic mode, Dispatch remains silent and you never get calls after the second day, which makes it pointless to even carry a gun. In Casual mode though, there is no problem with Dispatch giving you calls.-Arcadish type game (You get points for completing 911 calls and arresting criminals as well as other police duties, all they do is count towards your rank as a police officer which is kind of pointless considering the only thing being a high ranking police officer provides is better pay. No rewards other than being a State trooper allows customizable vehicles.  -Crime rate is way too high which leads to boredom of the game really really early, and leads to repetition, which is why people tend to only get about 9 hours in on average before never playing it anymore.I pulled over one drunk driver, only to have 2 more drive past me as I was getting out of my cruiser.Then another car sped past them in the oncoming lane going way over the speed limit, and meanwhile Dispatch telling me that there has been an assault in the area.FOR GOD SAKES I AM THE ONLY POLICE OFFICER IN THE ENTIRE GAME D: I can only do so much.

content:
Posted: October 25, 2014
												I know I only have about 2 hours playing this game, but I just have to state that I am having no issues with the old-style graphics (and if you are a "graphics make the game" kind of person... God save your soul!), the random floating cars are rare (No-one else mention that?) the combat system is based upon your characters well-being (so your aim will be sh*t if you are tired/hungry/stressed) .Game runs smooth.No option to adjust audio settings whilst in-game (Scratch that, I missed that part lol)You are the only Cop in the 7 areas (for now I hope, in a future update maybe there will be the ability to call for back-up)The options are very basic (early-access, give it time) hopefully in the future you will be able to have specific actions, like ticket amount or time spent in a cell for crime committed etc.Really good game, practically one of a kind as there are very few games that are open-world play-as-police games.9/10 Would recommend for any budding bad*ss :)

content:
Posted: July 2, 2016
												Pretty good game. It's hard to beat some of the mods for GTA (LCPDFR), but this game definately comes close and has a lot of enjoyment. It's very stable, and has only crashed a hand full of times on me (Mac OS X). The creator really spent some time with and polished it up nicely, and put a lot of details in like customizing the vehicles, different incidents, and different missions to do. The driving is awful though. The vehicles have poor handling and are difficult to drive. Also, you have to manage stress, sleeping, and hunger levels in the game. To me, that's just a waste of time, I just want to play a cop simulator and not worry about the rest of that junk. To reduce stress, you have to go out with your mom, friends, etc. The game is a little bit more encompassing than I would have liked. Although the game definately met my expecations for being a cop game, and it just missed the mark of my ideal cop game ever so slightly.

I had my gun drawn on him as I approached him. After I approached him, I asked him if I could see his id. When he went for his ID, I shot him because I thought he was going for a gun. He ends ups dying and I lose my job. The next day, I'm hired at another police department.  10/10 REAL POLICE SIMULATOR

content:
Posted: October 24, 2014
												I bought this game because it look like a pretty good game so far i have ranked up.Buggy: yes the game is a bit buggy but what do you expect out of a game when it newly fresh also the streets do need to be redone some arears the road sticks up. Sound: is pretty good but also a little buggy sometimes.Mission: you won't get board of the mission but the only thing is the timer in which you have to complete them.Weapons: you get the standard weapons  Gun, taser , and machine gun.Stress Relief System ;  It's okay but you either have to visit friends or family or watch TV to be calm.Eating and Sleeping:  Just make sure you watch your meter before it drains.Fuel consumpton and Damage :  To me i think it too much but hey can't live in god mode all the time  just make sure you fill up.Money; It takes alot of money to do things but really why the high prices.Vehicles:  Crown victoria, Dodge Charger, SUV and a undercover Crown Victoria  Depending on your Ranking.Vehicle Etc.  You can change the lightbar the light bar color wheels and paint.Character:  You can pick between a Male or Female it lacks customization.Movement:  Needs ImprovementShooting:  Needs ImprovementGraphics:  Needs Improvement.Forget it the games needs a ton of improvements.But i could go on but i don't want to board anybody. Might edit this after work.Overall Truth:Do not waste your money on this. I only do this to  help other people out.  The Developers have enough experience to really do a good game but choose not too,  The only really thing I do not like about this game is that you are the only cop in town there no backup no nothing noone to help you when you need it.  I know its a small town but my goodness why put alot mor pressure on the player.Game Rateing is a 3 out of 10.

content:
Posted: March 1, 2015
												-So my first day on the force as Officer: Officer Hyena-I am tasked with finding cars parked in the wrong spot. I leave me car halfway on a sidewalk to investigate in a town consisting of about 3 blocks of houses-I find around 6 cars, give them tickets, give one correctly parked car a ticket because it was an ugly shade of yellow. I can no longer find my car.-Hear a report of a woman buying drugs. I go toward the general area of the crime on foot-It is at the other end of the town-It leads me down an alleyway. I round the corner and she shoots me in the face with a military grade assault rifle-But she is white so I taze and handcuff her-I don't have a car to transport her-Her punishment is to WALK the entire distance of the town handcuffed behind me.-I then get a report of a kidnapped child-My shift already ended. I get a taxi home and sleep. After all: 'The first 24 hours are the least important time to find someone who is kidnapped.'-Best 30 minutes of gameplay ever

content:
Posted: February 13, 2015
The game is awful.
It's full of bugs, it's so raw that if it was a chicken it would still be making eggs.
The mechanics are awfully poor and bad implemented.
House customization -> only appearance, it does not help you recover stress faster.
Recovering daily stress -> spending 1 minute repeadly clicking the television each time starting an awful animation of you watching television.
Replenishing ammo -> BUGGED, you spend 100$ to "BUY AMMO" and it only replenish the cartridge inside the weapon, not the others.
You spend most of the time with dumb quests like "parking tickets", "make the alcohol test to driver", "place the radar and go afk to make yourself a coffee while the quest completes by itself" and after those the number of quest is really little and repetitive, there's no campaign questline, just a bunch of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ secondary quest, bad implemented, bad animated.
The list of this game is so long that you should try it just to see it by yourself, this is a game of "police" and I find it ironic the devs asking 20€ for it, it's clearly a legalized robbery.
I can just wonder if this game was made by a drunk russian guy or something.

number of helpful: 1 of 7 people (14%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 30, 2014
												I don't recommend this game because it crashes often... The concept is solid, but the programmers really needed to test it on more systems. 4 gb of ram for this game is a steep requirement?! I can run the Sims 3 with most of the addon content all day long without crashes!I meet all the requirements yet when i try to leave my house dressed as a cop the game crashes every time. I can seem to leave the house as the off duty version of my protagonist, but as the cop it's a no go. I have a suspicion that the way the programmers have the game handling the memory allocation has something to do with this issue. I think the game is trying to load everything in one big data dump on the computer eating all the memory all at once. I also found that it crashed out upon trying to re-enter my house as the off duty version of my character, again sounds like poor memory handling coding.Interestingly enough i tried running the game in 256 color mode and it runs, except the game is unplayable because it looks like you have the predator's eyes...At least it wasn't very expensive, but i really wish the developers would have told everyone that they needed 8 gb of ram instead of 4 to run a flash game...

content:
Posted: July 31, 2016
												プレイ時間: 47分総評: 定価19.99ドルは商売を舐めすぎ。ていうか1ドルでも高い。普段はタイトルとか考えてレビュー書いてますがこの作品に関してはそれすら考える事がめんどくさくなる程に本作をゲームとして楽しめる要素はありませんでした。ですが私はどうしてもこのクソゲーを間違って買う人が一人でも減る事を願い、こうしてレビューを認めています。とは言え、私の文章力では本作の一体どこが面白くないのかを挙げる事も出来ません。なぜならば、本作をプレイした47分間のただ一片とも「ここは面白かったな」と思える箇所が無いからです。ゲームエンジンの問題からキャラクターのRagdollが突如プルプル震えただとか、85度くらいの斜面を車両でBig Rigsよろしく登りきれるだとか、なぜか自宅と警察署を除く全ての建造物の内部に家具などが一切なく、屋内でも外が雨ならNPCが室内で傘を差しているだとか、おもしろSSやネタ動画のソースとしては使えない事もない事を除き本作を楽しめる方はごくごくごくごく僅かではないでしょうか。あらすじ主人公であるあなたは理由はよく分かりませんが片田舎に引っ越すと同時に自動的に警察官になっています。あなたの自宅には専用のパトカーが友人か何かのジョージによって置かれたまま放置され、お前は警察官になったんだから自由に使っていいという事を自宅のPCのemail内で明かされます。おわり。真面目に書けよ私はいたって真面目にこのレビューを執筆しています。先のあらすじを書いた本当の理由はこのゲームは一事が万事このようなノリのまま全力でプレイヤーを置き去りにしている事を伝えたかったのです。あらすじに関しても本当にこの通りであり、それ以上もそれ以下もありません。ゲームの目的も一切明かされませんし、チュートリアルも存在しません。更に言えば現時点ではSteam上にすらプレイガイドが存在していないのです。私は47分しかこのゲームをプレイしていませんが、恐らくこのゲームの目標は「犯罪者を挙げ、報酬を手にし、自宅に家具を買う」事です。いえ、見間違ってなどいません。もう一度念の為に書きますが、このゲームは「犯罪者を挙げ、報酬を手にし、その報酬で自宅に家具を買う」事です。意味が分かりませんか？私にも分かりません。オチもありません。本当にそうですから。なおこの家具に関しては購入すると勝手に設置されていく為、ハウスカスタマイズという要素で楽しむことは不可能でしょう。プレイを開始したら即座にワードローブに向かい、着替えなければ外に出ても何も出来ないため制服に着替えて外出します。すると間髪入れずに無線が入り、「検問をして怪しい車を挙げろ」というミッションが下されます。私にはこのミッションの達成方法が最後まで分かりませんでしたが、自宅のマイパトカーを左クリックする事によりカラーコーンを立てる事が出来、それを道路に並べる事で一般車両が停止することを発見し、車道に立ってみたら車がプレイヤーに激突しプレイヤーが車にめり込みスタック、カラーコーンを数個以上置こうとすると画面中にYou can't put anymoreというエラーが並び尽くしHUDを専有とい珍事が発生させる事は出来ました。尚、これはプレイ開始から3分で発生した出来事です。結局当該ミッションのクリア方法が分からないまま散歩を続けていると、突如「空き巣が発生、現場に向かえ」という指示が無線で飛んできたのでマップ上で赤く光っているドットの地点に向かいました。その家に到着し、「ドアを開ける」を選ぶと礼状がないので開けられないと言われたので仕方なく「警察だ開けろ」を選択した所、そこには先に挙げたようにがらんどうの室内で傘を差したままこちらを睨みつける住人がいました。その住人の前でEを押してインタラクトすると会話ができましたが、選択肢が「何かありましたか」しか存在しなかった為、それを選ぶと「何もなかったわよ！ありがとう」と言われミッションクリアとなりました。おかしいだろ。Steamだとは言えネタでも買われないゴミこのようにゲームの面白さは皆無ではあるものの、プレイした時間＝話のネタが増えるという面で言えばSteamというストアの概念を既に超えたコミュニティー上ではもしかすると購入する価値はあったかもしれませんが、本作は超強気の19.99ドルが定価のためにおいそれとギフトする事も難しいのでこの面でも存在価値がありません。かと言ってBig Rigsのように派手にぶっ壊れた動画も恐らく撮る事ができないのでその筋の方にとっても価値が低いでしょう。残った用途としてはクソゲー実況用でしょうか？それでも盛り上がりに欠けると思いますが。私は本作をgiveawayで無料で手に入れましたが、このクソゲーに47分間のプレイ時間と5分ほどのDLに時間を費やした事を悔やんでなりません。もし本作を購入していたら当然ながらRefundに踏み切っている事でしょう。通常考えうる楽しむためのプレイを目的としているなら、本作の購入は見送りましょう。

content:
Posted: January 19, 2015
												Day One:-Ticket illeagally parked cars.Day Two:-Arrest a drunk driver.-Ticket speeders.Day Three:-Shoot and kill an "innocent" black guy.Day Four:-Arrest a vandal.-Shoot, but save a white murderer.-Ticket speeders.Day Five:-Shoot and kill a group of black people (I bet they were in a gang!)-Chase down a fuel truck.Day Six:-Dinner with mom.Day Seven:-Stay at home, still get paid.Day Eight:-Kill more black people.Day Nine:-Break into a random house for no reason.Day Ten:-Shoot another black guy.-Get promoted to Chief of Police for ethnic cleansing.Day Eleven:-With no black people aside from me left in Mountain Valley, I commit suicide to allow the KKK to dominate the town!-Respawn.Day Twelve:-Repeat.I love how this game captured the realism of being a police officer! Not only can you kill black people, but you don't have to stop for red lights!!!10/10 would kill black people again!______________________________Really though, this game is fun. The graphics are PS2 era and the controls are a little wonky, but the game is pretty solid.   There is a decent amount of things to do, so for the price point ($21.99 CDN) I would reccomend it if you love police games, movies, shows, etc. If you are only semi-interested, I would purchase during a sale.Also, the game was made by just four people, so it's nice to support them. This game is really good considering only the four of them worked on it.

												Avoid this game at all costs. EXTREMELY poorly optimised, poor graphics yet still runs like garbage. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 22, 2015
												I love this game because you can finally be a police officer. You, the only cop in town, have the authority and people listen to you! While you do the normal missions, dispatch can call you for various emergencies. YOU HAVE TO SLEEP AT LEAST 8 HOURS EACH NIGHT IN ORDER FOR THEM TO KEEP CALLING! Taking two gunshots can get you killed, so gunfights are especially nerve-wracking. Sometimes if you pull over a person and they run, you have to draw your tazer and press C to make them stop.   There are also realism factors like turn signals, the warning horn, and others. You have to shut off your engine to exit the car, but once you reach 12mph or lower you can press R, the car will stop, and you get out.  Love this game and love that the Devs are still working on it!

												At the current price tag of 20 euros I cant recomend this game, maybe in a steam sale for less .The game has a very good idea but thats about it, it has a lot of cons so lets start with the good things to soften the blow-Pros,-Good idea-certain mechanics like random "special" assignments add a bit of flavour to a rather bland game-It runs on a low spec PC (Due to horrible graphics :)-Cons,-HORRIBLE graphics-Repetitive on duty tasks-Off duty tasks and activities add absolutly nothing to the game. (Could have been better for you to always be on duty, in my opinion.)-To go off duty, if you are in a remote region you must pass through other regions to get to the police station, you will get assigned rutine missions as you pass through each sector. This might not seem like a problem to you now but when you start to get into the game you will find it very anoying.-Firefights are very random, example: Stop a normal car on a rutine alchohol check, car stops, driver gets out and starts running away, i persue the driver through the streets, she stops, turns around and puts hands in the air, I tazz her (my bad) and she just pulls out a gun, pumps me full of lead and BUM! Im in the hospital.This game had a lot of potential but franckly is not worth your time.-P.S: Game stopped working when I stop civilian vehicules, the keyboard is disabled and I cant do anything. Left me with a bad feeling, I cant play it anymore!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 25, 2015
												I took a chance on this game despite the mixed reviews and was disappointed with the result. This game really should be on as early access because it is far from what I would expect from a completed project. The AI is poorly coded, for example I parked at the roadside to set up a speed camera and within seconds 6 npcs were walking continuously against the boot/trunk of my car going nowhere.When you arrest someone they magically teleport to you as you lead them back to your car and if you stand still they start to circle you like a derpy shark. There's no tutorial to explain how anything works (probably because most of it is broken).The vehicle handling is laughable and the lack of softbody physics is brought sharply into focus when you crash into a lamp post only to come to an instant halt.The camera clips through walls and gets stuck on the outside of the car garage when you drive inside.There's an unacceptable number of bugs and poorly delivered gameplay elements here that leaves me astounded that the developer would honestly believe that this was ready to move into beta never mind a full release.DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY! Hang on for "Police 10-13" it looks like it could be a great game and more importantly the devs are active with their community.0/10

As well, vehicle handling, in my opinion is nearly impossible. 0-150 KM/H in 3 seconds? and slowing down.... good luck braking from 150, because when you do, you will lose control of your vehicle, and likely hit a few cars, damaging your police car, forcing you to waste your earned in-game money, and losing score to call a tow truck to fix your car that was damaged beyond believe upon hitting a no parking sign. Until this update comes out, that was promised mid-July, but no notice has been given as to why, in early August, there is still no update. Unless the update covers the biggest issues I can find in this game, such as vehicle handling, ( which also makes it impossible to get into a good position to arrest drug dealers ) this game is lacking. As well, I have seen a few bugs so far, such as people walking over my police car ( yes, they litterally jump up, walk over the roof, down onto the hood, and keep talking on their cell-phones like nothing happened ) or stuck spinning around behind some vehicle they constantly keep walking into. You have alot of work to do devs, and if you ever manage to release the much-awaited, and promised update, I will be happy to revise my review. But until then, I do not recommend this game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 11, 2015
												As current law enforcement I can say that this game is decently close.. But still has room to expand.Positives:Decent RoleplayEasy controls/Xbox 360 controller compatibilityCustomizeable vehiclesInteresting scenarios, from traffic stops to drug bustsLarge map with varrying terrain/environmentsNegatives:Graphics are a little behind the times, and some animations become flawed. The former is tolerable, but the latter could use minor work.Load points are.. Obvious, a bit to obvious. You can see their green glow from far across the cell. Other than visually unappealing, they function well.Perpetrators tend to have three modes, shoot, run, or surrender. When they shoot, it's tolerable, and requires some fast thinking. When they run, there is an issue.. You character can't run as fast as the AI, so being away from your vehicle on foot chases always fail unless you can get them to surrender quickly. When they surrender, there are some arrest issues. Such as when you go code 3 because someone blows through a blockade, pointing a tazer at them costs points. Other times they work fine.Cars/people are unvaried. There are a couple several models for both, different clothings, skin colors, car colors, and issues with the cars. However, increased detail, in-depth conversations, random generated rap sheets and more models and even clothing would make the depth and roleplay value tenfold.Physics is... Simple. In Enforcer. Gravity seems to be low. The impact of wrecks causes more of an ice-skating situation. And punching the breaks at high speed causes some interesting/unrealistic sliding. Also, don't worry about running over civilians, they will levitate over your vehicle. And sometimes even run over the top.Vehicle specs/damage could be refined heavily. I have drove a P-71 Highway Inteceptor for a few years. The top speed is not 70mph, it is more in line of 140mph (With the govenor, it's more like 120). All vehicles need the physics refined, and the specs adjusted. The damage to the vehicles could be more specific. Such as flat-tires, optional upgrades for tires, bumpers, lights, ect..No fires. Ever. Which is disappointing. Happening upon a field fire would be nice. At least to report.You and the dispatcher are the only directly interactable public service. Other police vehicles/paramedics/tows and ect would be nice. Being able to call backup, or to see another officer pulling over speeders would be cool.Certian situations are cause for arresting someone. There are occassional bugs where someone shooting you will get you punished if you fire at, or arrest them.More/better houses could be added, upgrades and all that.More weapons/outfits/character customization would be nice. Actual vendors/shops and inventory would be cool.Instead of taking perps directly to the 200sqft police station/jail you should take them to a penetentary.Traffic lights and laws for AI needs repaired/overhauled.... I can't think of any more things right now, but I am sure to renew and revise this opinion as the game developes. I would very much like to hear from the developers about my views/opinions.All in all.. This game is well worth the price. It is good. It has potental. If you like law enforcement rp, buy it. :)

												First off I am loving this game so far. Some really good ideas and has been well excuted for a game still in early development.Here are some things I'd like to see implemented in the game.-Have more variety of missions as you move up the ranks. As I've ranked up I am still getting the same menial tasks while on duty. I'd love to be able to do drug raids and busts as well look for clues at a murder scene etc.-Have the option to choose a career track. Have the ability to choose whether to become a SWAT team member or Homicide Detective etc.-Have more things to interact with and do while off duty. Have a bar or nightclub where the player can go for a drink to lower stress or even meet a partner to date and eventually move into your home.-Have bigger houses to buy-Have food places modelled indoors. This could work gameplay wise with robberies in progress happening inside the places or hostage negotiation situations.-Fledge out the precinct indoors a bit more. As you rank up you get your own desk. You could also have a meeting room where the chief tells you about a wanted criminal to track down etc.-More NPC variety. Once you pull them over and as you walk up to their car they could take off and start a pursuit. I also haven't encountered any of them who try to punch you, it's either they run away or draw a gun. There should be an inbetween.-Add new items like pepper spray or baton you can use on unruly NPC's and Spike Strips for speeding cars who are dangerous.The game is still in early development and I am sure the developers have a lot of plans for the game they want to implement. I am keen to see how this game pans out in the future :)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 20, 2015
												Preemptive tl/dr; Nice concept, bad execution. Looking for realism? Don't buy. Looking for something like <Insert random word> Simulator 2014? Could give you some fun.Got off the bus near my house in the middle of the night, it's raining and I've just got a shirt and hotpants on, should've planned that better. Got a squad car in my rather crappy yard, suppose it's my colleagues wanting to greet me. Turns out it isn't, it's my own personal squad car with a never ceasing stream of chatter through the comm radio. Nevermind, I better go to bed instead. I enter my house and I feel the sudden urge to charge through the living room at full speed, I must've looked like a malformed gorilla with my freakishly large arms waving about. Oh well, at least no one saw me, I'll go to sleep now, wake up fresh for my shift tomorrow.I decide to take a cab to the station, seeing as I can't use the squad car in my yard. They all look funny at me when I arrive, I'm apparently not supposed to check in here at my shift, they tell me to just get changed back home and drive out, they'll assign me as I go. But they graciously enough let me check my e-mail on the computer and offer to sell me ammunition for 100 bucks. Seems kind of strange to me, at my previous assignment they equipped us with that kind of stuff for free. Oh well, note to self: Don't shoot too much.Once again I call the cab to drive me home. I check my wardrobe and there it is! My uniform, a handgun, a sub-machine gun and a tazer. Ready for all eventualities. I go out and enter my car, start it up and tries to back out the entrance to my rather crappy yard. This car handles like a rhino, at least when backing. But at least it accelerates quickly, I went from 0-110km/h in like 2 seconds. No one really cares when I speed past red lights on the sidewalk in 110. The perks of being a cop.First mission! Catch four speeders with the radar. Well that's ironic. Anyway, I drive out a bit away from town. If I should really call it town, more like a glorified block. I set up near a slope, that way they don't see me until it's too late. I go to get my radar and holey moley! There's tons of radars and cones in my car. I resist the urge to litter the entire area with radars and decide to just place two instead. That proves to be quite a difficult task though as the radar keeps falling over when I try to put it on the ground. After some effort and planning I manage to get a couple up anyway. A couple of people speed by, the radars automatically issues them a ticket, that's awesome tech. Suddenly this big freakin' truck comes wobbling across the road, I yell for him to stop the vehicle. He swerves into the side of my squad car and stops. I proceed to tell him to exit the vehicle and promptly does a breathalyzer test on him. He's clean. I'm pretty suspicious about the guy though so I ask for compliance, I frisk him and check his ID as well as the plates on the car. Nothing, he's clean, the truck is clean. Oh well, gotta let him go. It's not like I gotta pay the damage on my squad car by myself. Right?... Wrong. I call dispatch and they tell me to be more careful and charge me 600 bucks. I mean, c'mon.As I walk back to my freshly repaired car, dispatch calls about a kidnapping. I'm so all over that. I get in my car, blaze my sirens and drive around aimlessly. Where am I supposed to go? I start asking people if they've seen anything suspect. No one has. Dispatch calls again, says they have a possible location. 10-4. As I watch my GPS I realize that when I switch the settings from "mini-map" to "overview map", the map is rotated so they don't look the same. Very unintuitive gear they assign here. Oh well, I manage to find my way at least. I get out my car and draw my gun, I feel my adrenaline pumping. In panic I realize I can't crouch with my gun drawn, I simply can't! I'll have to manage anyway. I see them, a girl lying on the ground and a fat white guy just stands there, looking at me, before I get the chance to tell him to get on the ground, he pulls out a gun. I shoot him in the chest. He staggers but is still alive, he points the gun at me and I shoot him again, right in the chest. He staggers again but he's still standing! What kind of beast is this?! I pop off two more bullets in his chest and stomach. Still standing. One final shot and he's down. Mission complete. 200 points to me. I call an ambulance and they take both the perp and the victim away. No further investigation needed. That's efficient policework. I grab his gun from the ground and get back to stopping cars. There seems to be A LOT of drunk drivers here. One of them swerves right towards me, I panick, my life flash before my eyes and I prepare for permadeath. He crashes straight into me and comes to a complete stop, I didn't even flinch. Seems like I'm made of some tough stuff. I arrest him then I go home to sleep. Busy day.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 20, 2015
												Overall 7/10-------------Out of the hundreds of games I've played in my life, this is the first that I've ever found to make an honest attempt at a  general Police Officer experience (excluding dreadful paperwork and and the less interesting details).  The mechanics are a bit shoddy but ultimately functional 99% of the time so it's entirely playable for long periods without running into frustrating game breaking errors.  The graphics are comparable to The Sims zoomed into ground level, nothing impressive, but again it's tolerable.What stands out in this game is the wide variety of experiences and factors taken into account for each civilian and situation you encounter.  This game makes the effort to include experiences ranging from stopping people for speeding, broken lights, and swerving suspiciously to tracking a kidnapping or a drug dealer to a specific house, requesting a warrant, then searching the location for the potentially armed criminals and evidence lying around.Personally, I consider it worth buying for $15 or less if you're intrigued and don't mind the graphics or clunky physics of a small indie game.

content:
Posted: April 4, 2015
												I think this game is fantastic. We've all wanted to, at some point, be a police officer, driving around town in our fast police cars with sirens and lights blaring, answering calls and getting bad guys. This game tries to fulfill that childhood dream and has done a darn good job at it. Now I know the graphics arent superb, but the game has plenty to offer. Dense customization of your car and house, 7 different police vehicles to date, and the ability to purchase a personal car that you can drive off-duty. You can also attempt to persuade criminals to surrender, taze them, or shoot them in the face with a pistol, a submachine gun, or a fully automatic assault rifle (3rd option is my go to). Also the map is quite large, and split up into several regions.If I were to add/change anything in this game, it'd be as follows: have the ability to call for backup, because as of now you are the only officer in town. Also multiplayer would be nice, maybe even modes where you could play as a cop or a criminal. Also co-op, which would tie in with the "calling for backup". Also I would like the mouse sensitivity inside your house to be the same as outdoors, because inside it is really hard to look/turn around. Also different siren sounds would be nice ( I discovered today that pressing F changes the siren to like a phazer :D)And that just about does it. Thanks for reading this review, I tried not to make it too long. Now I must go, for I have criminals to mow down with an assault rifle! >:)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 6, 2014
												Let's cut to the chase here and say what has to be said: Good potential, bad execution. When I bought this I had expected they would bring me a reasonable 20 euros worthy product but what I got was a prodect that belongs either in early acces or in the "below 5$" section. As I started playing this game I thought "seems to lead up to something" but slowly as I played more I had grown to hate it. It offers very little freedom in what to do as you can do almost nothing at all. There's very little missions to finish and not even super mario for the nintendo 64 is more repetetive than this game. My typical day in a game like this is: I fill up the useless energy, food, and stress bar that are there for no reason by for one instance meeting up with friends (which you don't actually get to do, the screen just turns black for a moment) for no reason. I go to my closet and click on "on duty" below the 5 listed useless options of clothing you could wear when not on duty.  I walk out of my house and step in the car, look at the roads and see about 5 cars behind of each other of which 2 are halfway embedded into the ground, 2 are speeding in the most unrealistic way and 1 is driving like a total (ahum) "r'tard" because he/she is probably on alcohol.  I get a mission right away saying a drunk is behaving violently in the park so I go there with sirens and lights on. I drive over a steep mountain (cars in here are like horses in skyrim except they go 150 km p/h) and land on the dirt perfectly. I drive over a lantern pole (gta much) and get to the place. As always there is 2 witnesses and they describe the character, I see the exact matching description, walk up to the guy with my gun and turns out it isn't him, get a penalty for aiming at an innocent. I see the right person and walk up to them with a gun saying freeze and they pull a gun on me, by this time I start shooting the person and by 2 shots in the head the person lays down. Now apparently calling an ambulance will still work out. I get a bonus for shooting someone, and another bonus for shooting the ambulance.There is about a variëty of I think 10 missions intotal in this game and bare in mind that this whole story is a more action packed optimistic version of the actual game, in that way I am making commercial for them for over-appreciating how broken it is. Pro's:-You get to be a cop-Good concept-Driving is so broken it's funCons:-Repetetive-Looks like unfinished product (yet is not in early acces)-Anything you do in this game raises no excitement whatsoeverFinal judgement: 4/10Consumer recommendation:If you're a fan of the police and simulation thing do buy this game, you might actually enjoy it. (but don't get your hopes up) Best is to wait for it to go on sale. If this does not convince you here are some games that are cheaper and way better: Fallout 3, Fallout New Vegas, Mount and blade : warband. These are games I think you might enjoy if this game drew your attention.Producer recommendation: Game should be placed under early acces if this is an unfinished product (and believe me it is). And if you do consider this product finished: Don't ask 20 euros for it, it's a far way from being worth 20 euros.[Update] Recent changes have been made in this game, bugs have been fixed and playing it is not a general dread. Yet as I keep thinking this game should not cost as much as it does, it did turn out into a good game. I did not expect the producers to adress any of the issues since it was never stated it was Early Acces, but I am glad they did it. This is a buy, but only if you like simulation combined with police.Final final recommendation: 6.5/10

Posted: May 27, 2015
												Like others have said great idea, but poor execution. I tried really hard to love this game, and did at launch. However, it dawned on me just how little there is to do in the game. It also doesn't help that major things just as driving mechanics have not been addressed. Major features that were advertised seem to have no impact on game play, such as the stress mechanic. One issue I did notice was that when cycling through the graphics settings I was unable to go from "ultra" back to low, as the "ultra" setting would automatically crash the game on my PC. However, my computer is FAR from a top of the line gaming rig so I will not count that against the game; but it is something to keep in mind though.Overall, poor execution on a game that had a lot of potential, and honestly quite a bit of hype surrounding it all things considered.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 18, 2015
												The game is terribly under-developed. The quality of the game would maybe have been satisfactory 12 years ago, and even then, by low to mediocre standards. Very little content, very poor visuals (including animations, which are terrible), and the overall game mechanics are very bad. This is just ridiculous and I deeply, deeply regret making the purchase. I almost feel scammed, even though that's not the case. Almost everything about this game is bad (or at least developed very poorly). The CONCEPT of the game, however, is very interesting, so I'd rate the game 2/10 for that. If this had been pre-alpha, or some teenage game project, I would've understood, but this is just unacceptable.

content:
Posted: January 19, 2015
												Not a bad game at all. Has its glitches here and there but nothing game breaking, just minor things that occure not too often. Has lower gaphics but that doesn't take from the game itself. Controls took a little getting used to but after about 15 minutes you pretty much get the hang of it. I hope the developers will continue to add to this game, it has a lot of potential. Would love to see more regions perhaps as ways to pick where you want to work, like a bustling city instead of just the rural area, perhaps some more buildings to go into, even while on duty like stores, restaurants, ect. Kinda like how real officers do, who eat while on duty or patrol stores. More interaction with NPCs while off duty would be nice, such as building relationships or stopping in at a friends house and actually going to clubs or restaurants. Hopefully they are working on these or will consider it now it's been said. But over all I give this game a 9/10 and a recommend.

												I used to think that this game had a lot of potential when the game was released, back when the developers still cared about improving the game's entertainment and simulation aspect. Since early 2015, the game hasn't really received updates that would make the game less buggy and add more realism. Right now, with the type of care that the developers are putting into Enforcer, they are currently all talk but no walk. They promise then postpone repetitively an update that was scheduled for July 2015, the update was supposed to have small extra features. Three months later and still no word on the update's release date or progress. Then the developers even admitted they have no ETA on the update. People shouldn't expect this game to be a simulation; there are a lot of realistic features that aren't included, which makes the game very repetitive.

												Unfortunately, as many others have said this had great potential but the final product is a shoddy, buggy and under-developed mess.Make no mistake, I am the first to recognise this is an Indie game, from a studio that isn't well known-- but I feel as if they've been too ambitious, knowing their ability/limits as a small team. Posted: January 22, 2015
												Suprisingly addictive, has a few bugs to work out, although nothing major and not a problem as its a work-in-progress except in the realistic mode, found getting off repeat shots a bit 'laggy' which is a problem because if you die, your charactor is gone...in addition, it kicks out quite a bit of heat on my rig, which is suprising when i compare it to other graphics intensive games, nothing it cant handle though, some players with older machines 'may' struggle a bit.that said, i think its brilliant.. does make you feel like a cop... you get that REAL 'this guys wasted!' feeling as you cruise up behind a slightly weaving vehicle.All in all i say fun and addictive.. and it appears more updates are adding to it on a monthly-ish basis so far..it cost me 14.99 (GBP) roughly and wouldnt mind paying that again down the line for add-on upgrade or something to give it even more depth and missions vehicles etc..I think, i could be right in saying, with enough time and effort this could grow into a decent game series! and its already pretty good!

content:
Posted: January 21, 2015
												This game is great and I am having so much fun with it, although it feels much more like a early early access game then a release.Graphics: 2/10  On high the textures are nice but the overall scale and quality is poor.Dialouge : 0/10 NPC's never talk they just use text and you just use the same 5 phrases over and over and over again.Gameplay: 6/10 Although some stuff is boring I am really enjoying this gameSetting/Story: 2/10  The story as I've seen so far is non-exsisting you have a setup and then nothing more. The city you are based in is very bland and average, red lights also take waaaaay to long to turn green (not that it matters as you can run them at any time) One thing that dissapointed me was you never see another cop and you can't call for backup.What I think they should add:Other police officers around the city to make it not seem like you're the only cop around.Graphics over haulMore customization.Having to check ID's in your squad car to see if they're wanted.Higher chance of traffic stops turning to shootouts.Getting in trouble for arresting people wrongly/ breaking the law yourselfMore diversity of NPC's. I've pulled over the same guy like 30 times.Large scale crimes that require multiple units and SWATOverall the game lacks serious depth hopefully they will add some of these things and it will be a MUCH better game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 20, 2015
												Preemptive tl/dr; Nice concept, bad execution. Looking for realism? Don't buy. Looking for something like <Insert random word> Simulator 2014? Could give you some fun.Got off the bus near my house in the middle of the night, it's raining and I've just got a shirt and hotpants on, should've planned that better. Got a squad car in my rather crappy yard, suppose it's my colleagues wanting to greet me. Turns out it isn't, it's my own personal squad car with a never ceasing stream of chatter through the comm radio. Nevermind, I better go to bed instead. I enter my house and I feel the sudden urge to charge through the living room at full speed, I must've looked like a malformed gorilla with my freakishly large arms waving about. Oh well, at least no one saw me, I'll go to sleep now, wake up fresh for my shift tomorrow.I decide to take a cab to the station, seeing as I can't use the squad car in my yard. They all look funny at me when I arrive, I'm apparently not supposed to check in here at my shift, they tell me to just get changed back home and drive out, they'll assign me as I go. But they graciously enough let me check my e-mail on the computer and offer to sell me ammunition for 100 bucks. Seems kind of strange to me, at my previous assignment they equipped us with that kind of stuff for free. Oh well, note to self: Don't shoot too much.Once again I call the cab to drive me home. I check my wardrobe and there it is! My uniform, a handgun, a sub-machine gun and a tazer. Ready for all eventualities. I go out and enter my car, start it up and tries to back out the entrance to my rather crappy yard. This car handles like a rhino, at least when backing. But at least it accelerates quickly, I went from 0-110km/h in like 2 seconds. No one really cares when I speed past red lights on the sidewalk in 110. The perks of being a cop.First mission! Catch four speeders with the radar. Well that's ironic. Anyway, I drive out a bit away from town. If I should really call it town, more like a glorified block. I set up near a slope, that way they don't see me until it's too late. I go to get my radar and holey moley! There's tons of radars and cones in my car. I resist the urge to litter the entire area with radars and decide to just place two instead. That proves to be quite a difficult task though as the radar keeps falling over when I try to put it on the ground. After some effort and planning I manage to get a couple up anyway. A couple of people speed by, the radars automatically issues them a ticket, that's awesome tech. Suddenly this big freakin' truck comes wobbling across the road, I yell for him to stop the vehicle. He swerves into the side of my squad car and stops. I proceed to tell him to exit the vehicle and promptly does a breathalyzer test on him. He's clean. I'm pretty suspicious about the guy though so I ask for compliance, I frisk him and check his ID as well as the plates on the car. Nothing, he's clean, the truck is clean. Oh well, gotta let him go. It's not like I gotta pay the damage on my squad car by myself. Right?... Wrong. I call dispatch and they tell me to be more careful and charge me 600 bucks. I mean, c'mon.As I walk back to my freshly repaired car, dispatch calls about a kidnapping. I'm so all over that. I get in my car, blaze my sirens and drive around aimlessly. Where am I supposed to go? I start asking people if they've seen anything suspect. No one has. Dispatch calls again, says they have a possible location. 10-4. As I watch my GPS I realize that when I switch the settings from "mini-map" to "overview map", the map is rotated so they don't look the same. Very unintuitive gear they assign here. Oh well, I manage to find my way at least. I get out my car and draw my gun, I feel my adrenaline pumping. In panic I realize I can't crouch with my gun drawn, I simply can't! I'll have to manage anyway. I see them, a girl lying on the ground and a fat white guy just stands there, looking at me, before I get the chance to tell him to get on the ground, he pulls out a gun. I shoot him in the chest. He staggers but is still alive, he points the gun at me and I shoot him again, right in the chest. He staggers again but he's still standing! What kind of beast is this?! I pop off two more bullets in his chest and stomach. Still standing. One final shot and he's down. Mission complete. 200 points to me. I call an ambulance and they take both the perp and the victim away. No further investigation needed. That's efficient policework. I grab his gun from the ground and get back to stopping cars. There seems to be A LOT of drunk drivers here. One of them swerves right towards me, I panick, my life flash before my eyes and I prepare for permadeath. He crashes straight into me and comes to a complete stop, I didn't even flinch. Seems like I'm made of some tough stuff. I arrest him then I go home to sleep. Busy day.

												This is a Police simulator in the style of GTA. I say Simulator because it can get repetitive with your main duties are traffic stops with the uncommon mission of assaults and drug dealers providing some excitement.I played a character in Hardcore (can't be revived from death) for a bit more excitement and got gunned down by some drug dealers which I wasn't careful enough to secure before arresting.I picked this game up for free as part of a website's promotion, but it would still be entertaining if you can pick it up for less than $10.Some tips on the game, get yourself a TV and Couch, watching TV restores stress and energy so you don't need to sleep. You can finish your shift at home at your closet, this will save you the $20 and taxi ride home.

												Well, this game has a decent system. But when it comes to AI, I can't say that. So here is my scenario, I pull someone over as my mission, I park my car. I put road cones out. Also, apparently I am the only cop in existence. I have no way of getting backup and no way of help breaching a wanted suspect's residence. Could use a lot of improvement.

content:
Posted: January 19, 2015
												Not a bad game at all. Has its glitches here and there but nothing game breaking, just minor things that occure not too often. Has lower gaphics but that doesn't take from the game itself. Controls took a little getting used to but after about 15 minutes you pretty much get the hang of it. I hope the developers will continue to add to this game, it has a lot of potential. Would love to see more regions perhaps as ways to pick where you want to work, like a bustling city instead of just the rural area, perhaps some more buildings to go into, even while on duty like stores, restaurants, ect. Kinda like how real officers do, who eat while on duty or patrol stores. More interaction with NPCs while off duty would be nice, such as building relationships or stopping in at a friends house and actually going to clubs or restaurants. Hopefully they are working on these or will consider it now it's been said. But over all I give this game a 9/10 and a recommend.

												The game is based on good idea. Writing parking tickets, speed radars, roadblocks, breathalyser test drivers, responsing on calls, police ranks, police reports, police vehicle customizations etc. provide player experience of police work.The game has its flaws and bugs. Some parts of maps are empty and there is no point of going there, but it's very important to say that developers are working on new updates and patches. It will take time for this to grow in complete and good game/simulator.So if you want to support this project in early stage I recommend you to buy this game.This game should be marked on Steam as "Early acces." This is my only complaint.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 22, 2015
												Suprisingly addictive, has a few bugs to work out, although nothing major and not a problem as its a work-in-progress except in the realistic mode, found getting off repeat shots a bit 'laggy' which is a problem because if you die, your charactor is gone...in addition, it kicks out quite a bit of heat on my rig, which is suprising when i compare it to other graphics intensive games, nothing it cant handle though, some players with older machines 'may' struggle a bit.that said, i think its brilliant.. does make you feel like a cop... you get that REAL 'this guys wasted!' feeling as you cruise up behind a slightly weaving vehicle.All in all i say fun and addictive.. and it appears more updates are adding to it on a monthly-ish basis so far..it cost me 14.99 (GBP) roughly and wouldnt mind paying that again down the line for add-on upgrade or something to give it even more depth and missions vehicles etc..I think, i could be right in saying, with enough time and effort this could grow into a decent game series! and its already pretty good!

content:
Posted: January 21, 2015
												This game is great and I am having so much fun with it, although it feels much more like a early early access game then a release.Graphics: 2/10  On high the textures are nice but the overall scale and quality is poor.Dialouge : 0/10 NPC's never talk they just use text and you just use the same 5 phrases over and over and over again.Gameplay: 6/10 Although some stuff is boring I am really enjoying this gameSetting/Story: 2/10  The story as I've seen so far is non-exsisting you have a setup and then nothing more. The city you are based in is very bland and average, red lights also take waaaaay to long to turn green (not that it matters as you can run them at any time) One thing that dissapointed me was you never see another cop and you can't call for backup.What I think they should add:Other police officers around the city to make it not seem like you're the only cop around.Graphics over haulMore customization.Having to check ID's in your squad car to see if they're wanted.Higher chance of traffic stops turning to shootouts.Getting in trouble for arresting people wrongly/ breaking the law yourselfMore diversity of NPC's. I've pulled over the same guy like 30 times.Large scale crimes that require multiple units and SWATOverall the game lacks serious depth hopefully they will add some of these things and it will be a MUCH better game.

content:
Posted: May 26, 2016
												There are a lot of things I like about this game, and of course quite a few things that could be improved - but overall - it's kept me entertained.  I'd like to see a little more variety in tasks. It'd be good to iron out a few little visual bugs - like when someone gets out of a vehicle - there's still someone sitting inside, or when you tell someone they're free to go, and they still stand there gormlessly. An auto-rest option would be good - as it's pretty repetitive at the end of a shift to have to go home and watch the tv 4 times. The directing traffic option does nothing other than make you look silly. It's a good base game - has a lot of positives going for it - but if ever there's a version 2 - could do with a lot of improvement. If you just like the idea of cruising around in a police car issuing tickets and catching drunks, it'll keep you happy.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 8, 2015
												At first I thought this game wasn't worth my £7.49 I payed for it. However, the game wasn't as bad as I thought it was. The game does have some good points but I have noticed a few minor errors within the game that should be addressed. First of, there are some mistakes in spellings and grammar. For example in the "Contacts" menu, it says "4+h" when it should say +4h. Moreover, in a some places the developer has forgotten to add a "s" on the end of words.Another issue is that the car picks up speed quite quickly making handeling difficult. Moreover, the speed on the roads need to be increased. On long back roads the speed should be 50 or 60 MPH and not 30 MPH. This gets annoying when the NPC drive really slowly and you are stuck behind them...I am also having an isssue in the car customization and when I change to get on duty where the screen just freezes or I cannot move. I don't know if this is a problem on my side.Right now I just pull over random cars and find many things wrong with them without me even knowing. For example a car looks fine but when my officer goes to speak to them there registration plates are illegal or their brake lights don't work or they are drunk , but from their driving they don't look drunk... The game needs to add more of a realistic feel when pulling over cars. Overall, I would give the game 3.5/5 stars. As far as recomending the game to anyone, I am on a fence. This game still need a lot of work and I don't believe it is worth 15 quid. There are better games out there at around the same price. However, once all of the issues have been addressed then the game would be more fun and seem more realistic. It would be cool instead of making the car teleport to the station you could see the actual tow truck or prisoner transport show up and take them. The map also needs to be faced the right way as you do not know how many times I have taken a wrong turn due to the oreintation of the map.The game came out on the 24th October 2014. Right now it is the 9th April 2015. So I'm wondering what the developer has done as the game still feels as a Pre-release or Alpha version and not the full, final version of the game. The game can be fun but as days progess it feels like you are doing the same thing over and over again... Once the car controls have been masterd and most other elements of the games have been ironed out this game can become big! The game is fun at the moment but when new features get added the game will be a lot more. Kudos to the develpors as this is their first shot at PC gaming. Hopefully I don't have to change my review. Also get the game whilst it is cheap (7.49 pounds) as I don't see anyone buying this for 15 quid! Thanks for reading.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 2, 2015
												This game is absolutely unfinished, unpolished, and frankly broken. A lot of people have been saying that his game has a great idea with poor execution. Customization here is pointless only to just make your house look better. Visuals? I could care less about visuals as long as they dont make it horrible to look at. Here is the problem though, animation quality is terrible and i do get that animations are hard to make. Another extremely major problem here is that this game is marketed as a finished product but what we are presented here is clearly not a finished product. This is not marketed as an early access game as it should be. Sound effects are pretty bad besides a couple that i really do enjoy. The radio sounds are the things i have a problem with because they are taken from somewhere else and used over and over and over and over and over again. Voice acting isnt terrible but there needs to be more of it. Now onto glitches. When cars hit people they dont die........WHAT!? I'm not kidding. People don't die when cars hit them. Rediculous..... Also when i serve a warrant on a suspect's house, if that timer runs out and you kick a door down in his/her home, you will lose career points. That is BS. I see the same modeled person sometimes 2-3 times in one area. There is also very little missions to actually do in this game. When suspects run in this game, they go about 20 yards away from me then do what they were doing like talking on the phone, when THERE IS A COP CHASING THEM. If I was a cop chasing a suspect, they would be running as fast as they could not trying to re-blend in to a small crowd where if i catch up to them again, they pull a gun on me, WTF. This happens literally every single time i chase down suspects like a robbery  suspect, or a man who assisted in murder. There is also no other police units as in you are the only cop around for the shift, you cannot call for backup in a big firefight. I wouldnt have a problem with any of these said things listed above if this game was marketed as an early access title which it clearly is not. This game is not worth $20 because of it being so unbelievably broken with little content with a foundation that is unstable at best.

												The best Police Simulator (That is an actual game itself and not a Mod/Add on such as LCPDFR and LSPDFR for GTA IV and GTA V). I found my time in Mountain View as a LEO and Citizen to be very fun and adventures. The graphics are ok but I really dont care for graphics. Aslong as the game has no serious defualts with the graphics, I like it. The controls are good for me, easy to operate and execute a mission with. content:
Posted: March 16, 2016
												If you are a fan of the LCPDFR mod for GTA IV, this is a must have game! It has all of the elements of the mod but into its own game and quite a nice one at that. The cars have different models and I like how you have a life outside of being a police officer as well. However, you have to carry out different tasks (such as eating and sleeping)  in order for your character to be happy. I dont really like this part of the game primarily because it takes up a lot of in-game time which leaves you with barely any time to explore. This makes the game feel like a mod for sims.Other than that feature, I actually really like the game! Stopping cars because of speeding or wreckless driving is tedious for some but I for one could play this for hours at a time! This may deter you from the game but so be it, if you get bored of repeating the same actions then you will get bored of this game! The game is great and really has potential of what could be added to it like multiplayer, such as "cops and robbers" themed games. Love it!

												I usually don't vote no on recommendation for games, but I feel I should for this one. It's not that it's just completely horrible, it's not. However, the game controls are really hard to use and the movement/action of the character is not smooth by any twist of the word. I just find it so aggravating and tiresome trying to play this game because my character ends up doing things I don't want him to do or I can't figure out how to do something.On the flip, the idea behind the game is good. I like the police simulation theme and a lot of the ideas behind traffic stops, speed traps, responding to calls, etc. is really cool. But when I spend the whole (in-game) day trying to do only one of those, the game needs some work. I'm sure if you put enough time and effort into this game, you may get good at it and might actually enjoy it but the learning curve is crazy with this game. I'm sorry but I don't recommed this game.

content:
