												EDIT: Abandonware... THey built a good foundation and then killed it before they did any updates or upgrades to make it really good. Lame.Bought it yesterday and have been avoiding the family ever since. Loving it so far. Lots of room to explore. I like customizing the house and just tooling around looking for infractions. Missions are pretty good too. A few things though. Right now, since this is in Alpha there isn't much diversity in the things to do. Customizing the house, other than buying a tv and sofa seems to do nothing for you. The missions can be a little repetitive and occasionally you'll get 5 missions in a row and other days you'll get nothing. Controlling the car can be a little tricky but not too bad. For some reason, almost everyone on the road is drunk which makes it easy to find bad guys and level up.Putting these things aside and remembering that this is a brand spanky new game, it is a great bit of fun with infinite potential. If you want a realistic view of police life, I have to think this is a pretty good simulation that will keep getting better.By the way, the developers just posted pics from the next update on their Facebook page... looks like we're getting a police motorcycle soon :)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 8, 2015
												At first I thought this game wasn't worth my £7.49 I payed for it. However, the game wasn't as bad as I thought it was. The game does have some good points but I have noticed a few minor errors within the game that should be addressed. First of, there are some mistakes in spellings and grammar. For example in the "Contacts" menu, it says "4+h" when it should say +4h. Moreover, in a some places the developer has forgotten to add a "s" on the end of words.Another issue is that the car picks up speed quite quickly making handeling difficult. Moreover, the speed on the roads need to be increased. On long back roads the speed should be 50 or 60 MPH and not 30 MPH. This gets annoying when the NPC drive really slowly and you are stuck behind them...I am also having an isssue in the car customization and when I change to get on duty where the screen just freezes or I cannot move. I don't know if this is a problem on my side.Right now I just pull over random cars and find many things wrong with them without me even knowing. For example a car looks fine but when my officer goes to speak to them there registration plates are illegal or their brake lights don't work or they are drunk , but from their driving they don't look drunk... The game needs to add more of a realistic feel when pulling over cars. Overall, I would give the game 3.5/5 stars. As far as recomending the game to anyone, I am on a fence. This game still need a lot of work and I don't believe it is worth 15 quid. There are better games out there at around the same price. However, once all of the issues have been addressed then the game would be more fun and seem more realistic. It would be cool instead of making the car teleport to the station you could see the actual tow truck or prisoner transport show up and take them. The map also needs to be faced the right way as you do not know how many times I have taken a wrong turn due to the oreintation of the map.The game came out on the 24th October 2014. Right now it is the 9th April 2015. So I'm wondering what the developer has done as the game still feels as a Pre-release or Alpha version and not the full, final version of the game. The game can be fun but as days progess it feels like you are doing the same thing over and over again... Once the car controls have been masterd and most other elements of the games have been ironed out this game can become big! The game is fun at the moment but when new features get added the game will be a lot more. Kudos to the develpors as this is their first shot at PC gaming. Hopefully I don't have to change my review. Also get the game whilst it is cheap (7.49 pounds) as I don't see anyone buying this for 15 quid! Thanks for reading.

content:
Posted: August 4, 2015
												not a terrible game, I appreciate it is quite realistic ( despite skipping cutscenes where the tow truck tows the cars away, or the police van takes the criminals away ) and replacing them with 2-3 second black screens. As well, vehicle handling, in my opinion is nearly impossible. 0-150 KM/H in 3 seconds? and slowing down.... good luck braking from 150, because when you do, you will lose control of your vehicle, and likely hit a few cars, damaging your police car, forcing you to waste your earned in-game money, and losing score to call a tow truck to fix your car that was damaged beyond believe upon hitting a no parking sign. Until this update comes out, that was promised mid-July, but no notice has been given as to why, in early August, there is still no update. Unless the update covers the biggest issues I can find in this game, such as vehicle handling, ( which also makes it impossible to get into a good position to arrest drug dealers ) this game is lacking. As well, I have seen a few bugs so far, such as people walking over my police car ( yes, they litterally jump up, walk over the roof, down onto the hood, and keep talking on their cell-phones like nothing happened ) or stuck spinning around behind some vehicle they constantly keep walking into. You have alot of work to do devs, and if you ever manage to release the much-awaited, and promised update, I will be happy to revise my review. But until then, I do not recommend this game.

Posted: August 8, 2015
												At the current price tag of 20 euros I cant recomend this game, maybe in a steam sale for less .The game has a very good idea but thats about it, it has a lot of cons so lets start with the good things to soften the blow-Pros,-Good idea-certain mechanics like random "special" assignments add a bit of flavour to a rather bland game-It runs on a low spec PC (Due to horrible graphics :)-Cons,-HORRIBLE graphics-Repetitive on duty tasks-Off duty tasks and activities add absolutly nothing to the game. (Could have been better for you to always be on duty, in my opinion.)-To go off duty, if you are in a remote region you must pass through other regions to get to the police station, you will get assigned rutine missions as you pass through each sector. This might not seem like a problem to you now but when you start to get into the game you will find it very anoying.-Firefights are very random, example: Stop a normal car on a rutine alchohol check, car stops, driver gets out and starts running away, i persue the driver through the streets, she stops, turns around and puts hands in the air, I tazz her (my bad) and she just pulls out a gun, pumps me full of lead and BUM! Im in the hospital.This game had a lot of potential but franckly is not worth your time.-P.S: Game stopped working when I stop civilian vehicules, the keyboard is disabled and I cant do anything. Left me with a bad feeling, I cant play it anymore!

												Like others have said great idea, but poor execution. I tried really hard to love this game, and did at launch. However, it dawned on me just how little there is to do in the game. It also doesn't help that major things just as driving mechanics have not been addressed. Major features that were advertised seem to have no impact on game play, such as the stress mechanic. One issue I did notice was that when cycling through the graphics settings I was unable to go from "ultra" back to low, as the "ultra" setting would automatically crash the game on my PC. However, my computer is FAR from a top of the line gaming rig so I will not count that against the game; but it is something to keep in mind though.Overall, poor execution on a game that had a lot of potential, and honestly quite a bit of hype surrounding it all things considered.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 14
												I've bought this game back in early 2016 when it was on sale for $9.99, so basically 50 percent off. I bought this game because it was police oriented and was suppose to be like a police simulator. WRONG. It's a decent game at first and you will enjoy the first hour or so of gameplay, before all the bugs/glitches/bad mechanics become annoying. The game costs $20! It should be the greatest police simulator I've played. But it's not. The game is entirely full of bugs and glitches. Too many for me to explain. But there are glitches while driving, a bug where you can shoot and the bad guys shoot you before you can even react, and sometimes it doesn't even load properly.Do I recommend this game? No. Why? For the same price, or even less with discounts and sales, you could buy Grand Theft Auto 4. Why am I recommending GTA4? I assume that if you are looking at this game because of the fact that you want to play a police simulator type of game. There is a mod available for GTA4 called LCPDFR, it basically turns GTA4 into the best police simulator out there. And the fact that you can mod GTA4 to add new guns like the Glock 17 or cars like Crown Victorias make it so much better. And there are mods like ELS which add a more extensive lighting system. For the same price of this game! It's basically a no-brainer. I also have decided to spend the full $19.99 for GTA4, and it's a dream! I have since played it and it works great with my machine. I do have to say though, if you have a low specification computer, GTA4 might not be the game for you, but check out the minimum specs to see if you qualify to play it.Recap: Don't buy this game, it's badly optimized and a complete mess. I recommend GTA4 as a substition for the same price.

content:
Posted: April 26, 2015
												*************DO NOT BUY! THIS IS AN UNFINISHED GAME AND THE DEVELOPERS CLOSED THE STUDIO. NO FUTURE UPDATES! WAIT FOR POLICE 10-13 TO LAUNCH!!!************The game is actually very entertaining. You just have to go into it with an open mind that it is still in the works, otherwise all the bugs will irritate you. As of now, everything is pretty routine.  As of now, it's like a mobile game, in the respect that it is just sort of a time killer. Not something you will spend all day playing, but it is fun for a few hours.If you like 3rd person games, and a police simulator that is actually pretty in-depth, I do suggest picking this up. Hopefully, it can only get better. They have already patched some irritating issues, like the invisible jumps in the middle of the road that send you into the sky for a meet and greet with jesus christ himself.What can you do?1.) Stop cars and check registration / Administer breathalizer2.) Use NYC's stop and frisk policy on random people walking3.) Wait for a call for a suspected murderer, vandalizer, thief, or assault.4.) Set up a radar and sit back collecting 30pts per speeder.5.) Go home, pay $5 to your fridge to eat, take a shower, watch tv, go to sleep.6.) Rank up with points, which unlocks free new cruisers. (Better top speeds.... Goodluck staying on road and stopping.)The main bugs that hurt are:The randomly disappearing objects, such as a person you are in a foot chase with, or a car that you are attempting to stop. (Mainly because it gets out of range when you try to turn around your charger that steers like a battle tanker)Random gun jams on your weapon. The gun sometimes just doesn't fire, which leaves you clicking fast and sometimes unloading a full magazine into somoenes face.You cannot relieve stress fast enough. If you try to go out with friends and good ol mom in one day, you get penalized for being off duty too long. And a shower only gives VERY little relief.Cars can, and will run into you. Not that it hurts you, as your officer is Bruce Lee, and will ninja jump to the top on the car.

												This game was the game which really pumped me up. I'd been wanting a proper police simulator / game all my life, and finally I had it. I have played it a lot, and never seemed to get bored. All the time the developers posted new updates, features and new content. It was *AWESOME*.... while it lasted. Suddenly, with no prior warning or message, the developers had seemingly abanadoned the project, leaving an unfinished game with tons of bugs. It really had potential, but I guess the developers didn't care. Thanks for nothing. >:(

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 14
												I've bought this game back in early 2016 when it was on sale for $9.99, so basically 50 percent off. I bought this game because it was police oriented and was suppose to be like a police simulator. WRONG. It's a decent game at first and you will enjoy the first hour or so of gameplay, before all the bugs/glitches/bad mechanics become annoying. The game costs $20! It should be the greatest police simulator I've played. But it's not. The game is entirely full of bugs and glitches. Too many for me to explain. But there are glitches while driving, a bug where you can shoot and the bad guys shoot you before you can even react, and sometimes it doesn't even load properly.Do I recommend this game? No. Why? For the same price, or even less with discounts and sales, you could buy Grand Theft Auto 4. Why am I recommending GTA4? I assume that if you are looking at this game because of the fact that you want to play a police simulator type of game. There is a mod available for GTA4 called LCPDFR, it basically turns GTA4 into the best police simulator out there. And the fact that you can mod GTA4 to add new guns like the Glock 17 or cars like Crown Victorias make it so much better. And there are mods like ELS which add a more extensive lighting system. For the same price of this game! It's basically a no-brainer. I also have decided to spend the full $19.99 for GTA4, and it's a dream! I have since played it and it works great with my machine. I do have to say though, if you have a low specification computer, GTA4 might not be the game for you, but check out the minimum specs to see if you qualify to play it.Recap: Don't buy this game, it's badly optimized and a complete mess. I recommend GTA4 as a substition for the same price.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 26, 2014
												Update: 9/29/2016Stopped playing after devs stopped updating. It was fine for a little but since updates stopped coming the game has gotten boring.  I can no longer recommend this game.  Sorry...I only played two shifts so far but I am addicted.  Here is my report of the first two days.Day One: I started the shift out finding illegal parked cars and writing tickets.  I spent about two hours (game time) doing this when I received a call from dispatch stating there was a report nearby of two people vandalizing a building.  I then turned on my lights and sirens and sped to the location where the report was.  At first I did not find anything as I approched people to gather more information two indvidivauls, a male and female, began to run from me.  I pursued the male on foot calling out to him to him that I was the police and to stop!.  After about a 20 mins foot chase (game time) He finally gave up and I found drug paraphernalia on him and subsequently arrested him.  I radioed dispatch for a van to come take him away to jail.  I then went back to the scene of the crime and found the female not too far away.  She gave up immediately.  I took her into custody and transported her back to the police station.  End of shiftDay 2:I started off doing speed traps on a rural road for about 3 hours (game time) when I got a transmission from dispatch about a theft that just occured.  I turned on my lights and sirens and arrived at scene to a crying female.  I interviewed her and she gave me an accurate discription of the suspect that took her purse.  I subsequent search of the area I found the male traveling west on the southern most road of town.  I stopped him and idetified myself and he gave up.  I found drugs and further evidence on this subject.  I arrested him and took him to the police station.  After I cleared I noticed a car traveling and a high rate of speed and swerving back and forth.  I activated my lights and sirens and pulled over the car.  The driver was IDed and found that there was problems with his documentation.  I tickted him and cleared the traffic stop.  I then received a call from dispatch of suspcious drug actvity in town.  I then arrived and found the suspected person in the middle of a park.  I walked slowly towards him and IDed myself as a police officer.  The defendeant then pulled a firearm on me and shot twice.  I pulled my service weapon, shot and killed him.  I then called an ambulance to come and clear the scene.9/10  Would kill drug dealers againRe-Edit to the trolls* To those trolls who say 1.8 hours.  I am in business and am on the road playing offline more than online.  Offline hours do not count towards my hours played total.  Thanks

number of helpful: No ratings yet1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 9
												I won't complain to much, coinsidering I got this game for $2.17, which is about the right price. I definitely think this game should've been a F2P. And here's why:1. The physics are awful. In same cases you have to go all "GTA" on the criminals in vehicles, but oh my. Cars will flip for no reason, two cars can end up getting glitched together, and the speed, braking and turning is just ♥♥♥♥ing terrible.2. ♥♥♥♥ing good luck on foot! Every NPC who chooses to run from you runs at least 1.5x your speed if not 2x. In most cases you can get them to comply by pressing C (default button). And if that doesn't work, you must press the comply button while aiming a pistol or taser with the crosshairs directly on the suspect. If you can even ♥♥♥♥ing do it. The aiming is horrendous. Worst I've ever seen. So if a suspect starts to run from you, might as well just forget that mission. 3. Probably the thing that's most irritating is the amount of armed suspects. And it's usually almost always predictable. Not but just 30 mins prior to this comment I was playing. It had me do 3 missing persons cases. Each one was the exact same situation in the exact same area, in the exact same house, with the exact same outcome. 1 house down from the players house, injured lady (missing persons), armed male suspect, door opens upon asking. No need for warrent to open or kick down. Drug dealer's are always armed and open fire on you. Which most drug dealers might be armed, but I personally think it's a little unrealistic.4. Lack of any other law enforement. You are eapparently the ONLY COP in this city. NO back up at all.Now I will close this by saying: This game definitely had potential. But the devs seem to have abandoned it. Which really sucks, if they were to fix just these 4 core issues and maybe upped the graphics just a little, this game wouldn't be half bad and maybe worth $10. And nothing pisses me off worse than a dipping dev. Releases a half♥♥♥♥♥ barely finished game, takes the money, dips out on the game and it's community. Especially after the DayZ stunt, really proves some devs out there are just scamming. I may continue to play just to get my police simulator fix. But as soon as Police 10-13 comes out, I will log into my Enforcer PCA career, retired, unintall game, install Police 10-13, be glad I spent less that $3 for this game. So I recommend if you want to try this game, get it off of G......2........A's website. It's not worth more than $5.
